Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel, in a typical Euro City style.”
Reviews.Author: purpleTerry
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I choose this hotel for a four night midweek break. The location of the hotel is excellent, near enough to the Ramblas to be central but far enough away so that it is quieter. The desk staff were welcoming and provided a pack of information about trips at check in. They also managed a very efficient security box system which we used. The hotel has a generally good state of decoration and pubic areas were well maintained. Our room was clean, although small and the bed was a bit hard for our liking. The hotel bar was in the basement dining room, doubling with the breakfast room. It was competitively priced and a couple of very nice girls served us, but they were also laying out for breakfast on the tables around us so this was not a relaxing place for our night cap. There is a roof top terrace with a very small pool, which was too cold to use while we were there, but one night was warm enough to take our glass of wine from the bar to the terrace, which was pleasant. Breakfast was a self service buffet with a very extensive range of hot and cold items. The choice and quality was excellent. Over all this was a good place to stay and we enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: NellieScotland
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, room was small but comfortable and very clean, lovely comfortable bed with great squishy pillows, I slept so well. A great location with Metro Universitat across road, Placa Catalunya and Ramblas a short walk away. The staff were brilliant, very attentive and helpful. I will definitely return and recommend this gem of a hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bunraku
Reviews.Content: I've spent 3 nights at this hotel. Staff is very helpful and friendly, location is almost at the heart of the city, but rooms are very small and average. Take the rooms looking towards side road, otherwise it can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3* boutique hotel I've seen”
Reviews.Author: PillowHappy
Reviews.Content: For a 3* rating this hotel is positively excellent... good facilities, scrupulously clean, perfect location (5 mins from La Rambla and Place de la Catalunya but none of the associated madness from being right on their doorstep), on a shopping street and close to several metro entrances. The room was bigger than I'd anticipated for the location and the ensuite bathroom also surprisingly spacious. Breakfast was worth the €9 extra pp with a wide range of cooked and cold food, staff were friendly and all guests get maps and ad-sponsored guides to Barcelona at check in. What else would you want? The only even minor negative thing I could spot about this place was that the rooftop terrace didn't get the sun after around 6pm - and that's not their fault! I will definitely book this hotel on my next visit to Barcelona, a city worth several visits.

Reviews.Title: “The outstanding city”
Reviews.Author: mond315
Reviews.Content: Its my third time in the hotel and hopefully many more visits to come . The services and the room are very good and the location in the city center is very helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: ME Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good! Entrance and reception is great and looks very nice and classy. Also the terrace on the roof (solarium) is Superb! Nice and clean rooms. Great and helpfull staff. The best is the location! It has al big brands stores(starbucks/subway/footlocker/desigual/zara/C&A/sephora and many more in the same street as the hotel. 30 seconds walk to Rambla and Placa Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: no6bus
Reviews.Content: we booked about 8 or 9 months in advance and ended up saving €150 per couple per room and got a premium room for less than the price of a standard one. we had rooms 104 and 105 which had a private terrace each and were lovely peaceful places to sit. The furniture and fittings were of very good quality with a sony bravia tv, a ipod holder and a queen size bed. the location of the hotel is excellent with easy access to public transport at either end of the street and a couple of minutes walk to las ramblas. the staff at the hotel were very pleasant and efficient answering our questions very quickly and clearly. we had the misfortune to be leaving the hotel on the day of the general workers strike (29/3/12) but received information to our room the day before and on the day of departure were happy to arrange a taxi to the airport for us. guests are given use of a safety deposit box free of charge and also 3 days free wifi access. the breakfast room is in the basement but very nicely done out, as is the whole hotel, with a good choice of fresh fruit, cold cuts, as well as a choice of fried "english" type breakfast. we didnt bother with the touristic bus figuring €116 for a days travel around the city was a bit much and instead opted for a T10 ticket using it to go to the Sagradia Familia and from there using the metro to the Camp Nou then back to the hotel. we ended up spending €14 so saving over €100, although we still left plenty of the city to see on another visit. the following day we walked around the gothic quarter finishing up at the zoo and spent a few hours here afterwards catching a bus back to las ramblas.on a night we had a wander round las ramblas but always seemed to end up in the bar/restaurant Xeica just round the corner from the hotel, because it is a bar used by the locals it was the most reasonable priced we found near the hotel. fresh cooked food as well on the monday and tuesday it was fairly quiet however on the wednesday night when barca were playing away in the champions league quarter final the place was bursting with in excess of 200 people in the place and the subsequent atmosphere was electric mind a mass exodus at the final whistle. anyway i digress would we return to this hotel ?. a very easy answer YES.

Reviews.Title: “Clean small rooms and there are better hotels for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: billy_bruce
Reviews.Content: We caught the bus from the airport to playa cataluna (9 euros return) and walked to the hotel about 5 mins. I was suprised at actually how small the hotel entrance was and to be honest dissapointed by the size of our FIRST room.....it really was tiny open the door and fall into bed.....but we thought its nice and clean so off we went exploring. The first night well the room was like a sauna the aircon didnt work so the choice was to open the door or suffer. The next day we complained and asked to be moved to a room where the aircon works but were told its winter the heating was on and there were no rooms availible.......so we had breakfast which was not bad and decided as we hadnt been able to sleep that we would get a refund and go and get another hotel.....there are lots and lots nearby......... we were told we couldn't so i asked to see the manager......a phone call was made and then we were offered another room but it was going to cost us more money..... we said no thanks and asked to see the manager again.....another phonecall and suddenly we could have the other room free of extra charge......i wasn't happy especially as the manager could not be bothered to come and see us but my wife decided we would take the room and not make a fuss. This room was double the size of the first and a dam sight cooler. So thats the bad bit.....the good bits are location it is located at the top ramblas so plenty of shops bars restuarants etc, it is very clean which was good th e breakfast was reasonable although there were lots of problems with the coffee machine, the poor waitress certainly earnt her money. It was buffet style both english and continental. In summary i'll give as open a view as possible once we moved rooms dont get 310!!!!! its tiny it was ok. Very clean with reasonable food......but there are lots and lots of other hotels nearby and next door priced similarly or cheaper and i would definately look at one of them for better value....but thats up to you. Hope this was helpful and hopefully the manager will read this review

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FIND!!!”
Reviews.Author: daveandmardi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4 night stay before we boarded our cruise ship for a 2 week Transatlantic cruise. This was the PERFECT place to stay!! The breakfast was wonderful with so many different choices from hot bacon, to a cheese plate, different kinds of eggs, fresh fruit, homemade pastries and rolls with a wonderful combination of American and European flair. Our room was very clean and spacious, for European standards. If we go back to Barcelona, we will stay here for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, tiny rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: screamer23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, one minute away from placa Catalunya. If you are looking from the hotel from placa CAtalunya, look for Habitat shop, and it is on the road with the Mc Donalds at the corner.airport busses are parked in the square and leave every few minutes, a great service. Use metro blue line or green line les Cortes stop to see the great Messi and co. . The Market, la Boqueria on Las Rambla is well worth a look, for the colourful displays alone. Bus trip is also well worth doing, the blue line is more interesting but great way to see the city. It was €26 for one day and €33 for two days sight seeing. Los Coracoles restaurant is a unique place, really nice for a drink during the day and to sneak a walk through the restaurant. You walk through the kitchen with many chefs cooking up a storm. It's very quiet during the day. Devil's Kitchen bar is in a dodgy area and would not chance it after twilight but does a fantastic burger and for a great price too!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BobW2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inglaterra is in a great location just a couple of minutes walk away from the Plaza Catalunya and from the top of the Ramblas. However, it is also very reasonably priced - £80 a night for a double room throughout Christmas week, including breakfast - and the rooms are very comfortable and clean, if a little on the "cosy" side rather than spacious. It does lack some the features provided by 4* hotels (such as a large reception; gym; swimming pool etc) but if you don't need these extra features why pay for them? I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad internet service”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. location, food, room, clear, clean, ok. The only problem is the internet. Those who seek a decent connection will find a too slow one. I could hardly check my mail. They offer a faster connection for additional payment (10EU a day, smaller time chunks are available), so it doesn't sound to be a free wi-fi hotel anymore, which should be a basics in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “no wifi”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler171
Reviews.Content: The main reason that we chose this hotel was the free wifi. The hotel provided us a login ID and password. However, trying to login in successfully was like playing jackpot. It was like 1 in a 100 times that we could login successfully. The reason was 'maximum connection has reached'. We went down to reception for help and they hooked me up with technical support. I rather they said NO wifi service in the hotel. If you need access to internet, don't stay in this hotel. Breakfast was just ok. I had better in another 3 stars hotel. Staff were not friendly. I agree the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: mikeKentUk
Reviews.Content: As with other reviews location is great. We had booked the cheapest room which was rather claustrophobic so we asked to upgrade to a larger room, we found the staff to be extremely helpfull allowing us to inspect other rooms untill we found one to our liking and the cost was very reasonable as well. Unlike other reviewers we found the breakfast disappointing and would rather have gone out for it. So yes would stay there again but would skip the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Janet059
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. It is very centrally located - just moments from Las Ramblas and the hop on/hop off buses. Our room was very comfortable.with not one but two balconies. In the bathroom was a huge tub with loads of room to soak in. We took advantage of the breakfast offer (2 for the price of one) and were glad we did as there was plenty of choice. The food was fresh and tasty. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: FerWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near Plaza Catalunya. Our room was nice and modern, with a few great features: a very comfortable bed, a big window and balcony overlooking a side street, a wood closet with plenty of space, and A/C. Unfortunately there was neither an iron nor an ironing board in the room, or a safe box, that would have been very convenient for leaving valuables or travel documents. A big mirror was also missing - it would be a very simple addition since there was plenty of space in the walls or behind the entrance door. The bathroom was nice, but it did not have a fan or good ventilation. I was surprised that the hotel did not have easy Wi-Fi access. A free day pass to connect to an external network was apparently available, but completing the online registration form was very tedious and asked a lot of personal details, so we decided against it over privacy concerns. Plus, after completing the form, it seemed that we needed a working cell phone in Spain (that we did not have) in order to receive a text message with the password to access the network. The service was good. The concierge was very helpful several times when we asked for restaurant suggestions or information about sites. Breakfast (included in our rate) was very good, served in a nicely decorated area. We received a gift basked in our room, that included a plastic water bottle, one banana, one pear and two apples, but unfortunately no knives or napkins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterPaulR
Reviews.Content: 5minute walk from Catalunya Sq/Ramblas so perfect location, reception could not have been more helpful, breakfast good (better toaster needed if being picky), room clean and boutique type accommodation. Although November, weather was around 70degrees but it rained 3 of 4 days. Rooftop sun deck looked decent and worthwhile in hotter and drier weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: CASRunner
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room with a good location. The breakfast was very good (we had it included) and the front desk was able to assist when we had questions. The only issue was that they didn't have safes in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Orangesky18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in October this year and weren't disappointed. The hotel is a few moments walk from Plaza Catalunya which is pretty much central to everything, Las Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter, the Harbour, the markets the underground etc The hotel was clean, modern and quite funky. our bedroom was a classic so not too fancy but really didn't feel like a lower spec room at all, it was really great. All the towels and free bits an bobs were really great and not cheap. We were right on the street and just wouldn't have noticed at all as soon as we closed the balcony doors, plus the curtains were so dark and heavy that we really really slept well. Full airconditioned too, and heated if necessary. The ONLY downer about the room was the TV as it only seemed to have news channels on and the volume was preset to quite a low volume so we had trouble hearing it - would have been nice to have a bit more choice. Breakfasts were good, great choices to have and all the staff were really friendly and nice, and some tri-lingual. The (cold) little swimming pool and terrace at the top of the hotel was a real bonus, very Spa like and just a lovely treat on those really hot Spanish afternoons. I would definitely visit here again, although the price may put me into somewhere cheaper, if I had the money, I certainly wouldn't hesitate going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGG8350
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Barcelona in September 2011 and stayed at the Inglaterra. The staff was very friendly and helpful, great location and lovely, clean rooms and common areas... for a very reasonable price. We were offered the chance to upgrade to a junior suite for a bit more per day, which was wonderful. The small pool was fun after a hot day of sightseeing, and the breakfast (which was included in the cost of the room) was perfect. Free wi-fi was also handy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: GM1104
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located, close to Pla de Catalunya, the Ramblas... almost everything is at walking distance. The room was clean, the front desk service helpful and the included breakfast a great value for money. The free Wi-Fi connection terribly slow. When in Barca I'll book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 3 nights in August. The location is good. It is very near the Universitat subway station. And the station is on a convenient subway line. The rooms were average. I figured the rooms were not vacuumed daily, but I thought they should at least be cleaned before another guest checks in. The floor was dusty upon check-in. And there were visible balls of dust/hair under the table. The breakfast was adequate. The reception staff were not friendly, it is hard to associate this hotel as the sister hotel of Majestic. The staff on duty on one night, was even rude to my child. The hotel is closed from 10pm, as I was told by the rude man that night. I had a request for hot drinking water at midnight, to make milk for my child. I was told quite matter-of-factly that the hotel is closed from 10pm, and there would be no one to make any hot water. I was also told that it is "not Spanish culture to drink water at night", so it would "do us good to just go back to sleep and come down again at 7am for breakfast and water". I think this hotel is perfect if you're only looking for a place to sleep, and do not need to interact with the staff except at check-in and check-out. I will not stay here again even though the location is good. There are at least 2 hotels next to this one, and one hotel right opposite this one. So it shouldn't be difficult looking for another hotel within 200m of Inglaterra.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: superirons
Reviews.Content: Picked it as near the Ramblas and Place Cataluyna. Also not too expensive considering its location. Would certainly stay here again. Contemporary clean a/c room and bathroom. Free Wi-Fi for 3 days. Breakfast semed expensive at the advertised price, but they offer you a special rate of 9.50 euros if you commit. Glad we did as it was excellent. Large selection of cold meats and cheeses, along with a good selection of pastries and cereal and fruit. Plus a hot buffet scrambled eggs sausages bacon etc. Reception staff were extremely helpful and informative, although don't be tempted to buy the ' Touristic Bus' tickets from them', as you then have to queue forever in the Tourist board to validate them, easier just to hop on a bus. They managed to locate two tickets on the day for a Barcelona/Madrid football match, which my husband will be forever in their gratitude.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inglaterra”
Reviews.Author: seattlite_8608
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to the sites in Barcelona. The front desk was very helpful and spoke English. And the breakfast that was included was also very good. The price was more reasonable than others in the area so don't hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bkokoski
Reviews.Content: I am American, and this hotel was absolutely fine, but not great. Room size was good, beds fairly comfortable, clean rooms, good A/C, but due to the heat of the city it takes awhile to cool down. Helpful, courteous, English-speaking staff staff. Balcony could not be used due to a flood light, but there was no view anyway. Hotel common areas were a bit dingy and dated. Location was very close to Las Ramblas, metro, and lower Eixample shopping. Price was fair at 140 Euro per night. Breakfast area was stuffy, located in basement floor. Rooftop bar and very small pool, but did not use either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good size room.”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: In Barcelona all is about location and this place is great. One block from La Rambla st and one block from all the high end stores, metro, few blocks away from bar scene and restaurants. Also give you the European air in the room. WE LIKE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Eloise058
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in early September with a group of friends (7 people). It is very convenient to the The Rambla, Placa Catalunyia (at far end of the street) and transports links such as the metro (University M station at other end of the street). The hotel is nice and quiet. The rooms were simple but had everything necessary for our stay. The air conditioning worked quietly and very well ( it was over 30 degrees outside some of the time). The breakfast room, which doubles as the bar area, is in the basement and rather small and they did not seem to encourage use of the bar in the evening times. If you want a night cap best go to one of the nearby 4 star hotels for bar facilities. Breakfast is self service but has a nice variety of continental and hot breakfast food. The reception staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. This hotel is ideal for exploring Barcelona and in an excellent central location. The building is old but recently refurbished and our bedrooms had french doors opening onto very small balconies overlooking the street which was really nice, also there is a small solarium at roof level. We would all stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful oasis in a beautiful and busy city”
Reviews.Author: BostonCyclist
Reviews.Content: Background: we had booked seven nights at another hotel but upon arrival we were so disappointed that we walked right out to look for another hotel. After a dozen "we're all booked" responses, Inglaterra had a room available. We booked it for one night. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful. Their restaurant suggestions led us to some real "finds." the room was impeccably clean, modern and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was great. And the price was very, very reasonable. We ended up staying there all seven nights and I'd go back in a heartbeat and will recommend it to all my friends. There was not one thing I would have changed about the hotel or the staff. Plus, the location was centrally located but the hotel itself was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel, several months in advance, as it is not in las Ramblas nor on a major traffic route yet close to it all. Very lucky to get a room upgrade on arrival. The staff were very friendly and helpful with excellent English and a real desire to offer the best advice as to where to eat in the evening. Both nights we stayed we had a great time thanks to their assistance. Breakfast was good and the air con in the room worked. Safety deposit boxes gave peace of mind. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Nice little rooms in good area - very good value.”
Reviews.Author: seb a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the basic room type. Rooms were suitably fitted out, looked good and everything worked well: not brand new or immaculate, but certainly good for the price. Everything was clean (as long as you don't look under the bed), and was just enough room to stash of our luggage. There is a tiny little pool on the roof - perfect to sit in and have a beer on a hot afternoon. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and a little bit more”
Reviews.Author: Tertychenko_A
Reviews.Content: Located in the very heart of Barcelona: Rambla, Placa de Catalunya, El Raval, Boqueria market are all quite reachable from Inglaterra. Normal breakfast for just several nights stay, helpful personnel, maybe a little bit low-key entrance (several times I passed my hotel by). Great disadvantage uncovered itself during two last nights: there was disgusting urine smell (or sewage) when air-conditioning system was switched on! It was very hot this August in Barcelona, but we had to sleep without air-con because of that smell. I could recommend this place because it is in center (if you like Rambla), but repetitive problems with air-con (read another reviews) make me not to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Such a great hotel, right near La Ramblas, only a short stroll away. Across the road is the bus stop if you want to catch the hop-on bus. Rooms are spacious and clean, breakfast had alot to choose from! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo hotel”
Reviews.Author: fedtal
Reviews.Content: Ottimo hotel, staff gentilissimo, posizione eccellente e colazione abbondante.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Our Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fools4Food
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before a Silversea Cruise and felt we got value for dollar. Europe is expensive and everyone agrees there standards (star ratings) are a little different than in the USA or Asia. Our room was small, but quiet and comfortable, perfect for recovering from the long flight. Best point is the location. We walked everywhere during our stay here. I was concerned by reviews that said the neighborhood was rather seedy, it is not. As they say, it was a neighborhood with old world charm. I would definitely book here on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “We read the reviews but not so sure”
Reviews.Author: dnichols12
Reviews.Content: We based on decision on what we read here and due to the location. Hotel clean, front staff OK but not overly friendly. Should have read the small print but our "quad" was a full size bed with a pull out bed. I have stayed at many hotels and have never slept on a pull out until last week (maybe when I was seven). Surprisingly not a bad bed but squeezed in and annoying. We asked for a early check in and had to huddle by the roof top "pool" for an hour. Not a bad place but I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Eddy827
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona for 2 days and this was the greatest location, mins from la Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, the metro, etc. rooms were small but were clean and beautiful, overall was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bbumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a conference held in Barcelona, it was great! Great and friendly staff, great location next to the ramblas, great breakfast, definitely would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: meyeg
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in Spain and a wonderful introduction. The staff was very helpful and gracious. The location was prime and for the money, a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: VanessaMunYee
Reviews.Content: We were looking at Barcelona hotels and it was so hard to pick one because there are so many of them! We finally picked Hotel Inglaterra because it is very close to the famous La Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter. It was a little expensive but considering about the location, it was a good deal. It was about 5 minutes walk from where we got off - the Airport bus station at Placa Catalinya. We didn’t know it was that close because we couldn’t seem to find the hotel. We went to a cab and he refused to give us a right and kept pointing at the street behind us. If a cab refused to take us; that must be really close! We hauled our bags crossing busy street came to a junction and took us a while to figure out which way with the map we had…. Checked in without problem, reception staff’s service was ok – nothing special. We had a street view room. Room was clean and average size. Our queen bed was clean and comfortable. There is a flat screen TV next to the working desk. Bathroom was clean and not too small. They provide enough amenities. Breakfast at the hotel was good. Free wifi service was an added bonus for us. We may be back to this hotel because of it’s location – we could just walk to La Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Be sure you will have air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: graciegirl15
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in 75-80 degree weather. Imagine our surprise when we learned that we had no air conditioning, although the lobby was air conditioned. The story we got was that the manager had it turned off in the rooms because people were complaining it was either too hot or too cold. I believe that is why each room has it's own thermostat. We had a fan which only moved the hot air around. We tried to sleep with the windows open but it is very noisy in Barcelona at night, garbage pickups and singing drunks. So we tried to sleep with the windows shut but it was horribly hot all night and neither my husband or I got much sleep for the two nights we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Average stay”
Reviews.Author: NaplesFloridaJfk
Reviews.Content: Great location ,walking distance to most sights.Close to metro and walking distance to airport bus.Room was extremely hot the first night, when questioned, said air was broken.We asked for a fan which they brought up but was sweltering in room by then.On a busy street, but room was quiet, never heard outside noise.Nice bathtub.Room was average size, no real frills but adequate. Didn't eat breakfast at hotel.No lobby, just a sofa.Front desk cordial and helpful if asked for directions.Would stay again if the right price.And if the air was working. Enjoyed fat tire bike tour, well worth it for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about no roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Proudy77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for with a group of 4 friends for a 5 day stay in Barcelona. One of the main reasons I booked this hotel was the roof terrace, I was really looking forward to a few sunny beverages up there, however on arrival when we asked about it, we were informed that the Roof Terrace was out of bounds to guests as it was having a pool installed, This would have been nice to know considering I booked the hotel 6 months in advance and received no information of the work. When informed of this my friend allbeit not particularly politely asked for an upgrade of our room and we were given a smoking room (none of us smoke) which was very small and not on the same floor as the rest of our party who had a much bigger room, but as I said this is probably due to my friend not being polite so who knows. Apart from that the rest of the stay was ok, only 2 slight issues no glasses to rinse with in the bathroom and when I had a beer from the mini bar in our room, it turned out to be water! Someone had filled it back up after drinking it cheeky! They did swap it but were doubtful that is wasn't me - the only reason they did believe me is because it was stone cold. All in all this was a hotel in a great location far way enough away from all the noise of Las Ramblas and yet a 5 minute walk to all the action. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: rachelproby
Reviews.Content: A great location in Barcelona. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are definitely small and a tight squeeze, but that's not why we came to Barcelona! Lovely balcony and quiet at night. Breakfast is worth the extra 9 euro!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lady4Lunch
Reviews.Content: Received a warm welcome when we arrived. The guy on reception took time to go over a map of the city and gave us recommendations of restaurants. Any time we approached reception they were very polite and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Our room was a reasonable size for a city centre hotel and we had a room at the front of the hotel which was surprisingly quiet. We were offered breakfast at 9 euros per person and there was a good buffet on offer. Great location with a short walk to Placa Catalunya. Took the city tour bus for 2 days which means you can take in both the East and West of the city and covers all the sights. The hotel sells tickets for this which saves you queueing in the Placa. You also have one hour free use of the internet in the business centre which is handy for checking in for flights home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but street noise at night may bother you.”
Reviews.Author: mkirch72
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night pre-cruise. Picked this hotel because of it's relatlively low cost and location near the Placa Catalunya and the El Corte Ingles department store. We had one night, had been to BCN before, and knew we wanted to spend it shopping! Overall the hotel itself was great. Here is my breakdown: Pros: ---Very central location for sightseeing in BCN, just off Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas (this is also a con --- see below). ---Updated, modern hotel. Clean, contemporary rooms. Comfortable bed. Rooms had a flat screen TV, desk and small chair. Rooms were average size for Barcelona (those from the US will consider them small. But this is the norm in BCN so accept it and move on). Rooms facing the street have a small balcony with a view of Carrer Pelai. ---Exemplary staff at the front desk. Multi-lingual and very knowledgeable. ---Restaurant at the hotel itself. We did not take advantage of this, as it was a bit pricey. However, friends traveling with us raved about the breakfast buffet. Cons: ---Only con I can think of also deals with location. Because it is so centrally located, there was a LOT of noise -- mostly of young people partying -- coming from the streets. We were five floors up, had the terrace doors closed, and were still woken up by the noise at 3am. This is not the fault of the hotel, and this probably doesn't happen every night. But apparently we just got lucky. If I had to do it again, I'd probably ask if there was a room not facing the street. The view was nice -- but not nice enough to lose sleep over. ---Noise issue: while this did not happen to us, this happened to friends traveling with us who stayed on another floor. There were apparently a lot of young people staying on their floor and they were in the hall going from room to room, smoking, drinking, and basically partying it up till the wee hours of the morning. I asked if our friends reported them to the front desk and they did not. I would hope they would have done something had they actually called or asked the young people to keep it down. This is more the fault of my friends than the hotel, but in the interests of full disclosure, I thought you'd like to know. Overall we were very satisfied with this hotel. Clean, comfortable, modern rooms and staff that go above and beyond. Restaurant on-site. Location that can't be beat --- but can also keep you up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: faughan
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, the Hotel Inglaterra is a lovely little 3 star hotel in the heart of Barcelona city. Just off Rambla, the main street, and the bus from the airport the Aerobus stops right at Plaza Universidad a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We were checked in quickly by a very friendly and welcoming chap called Joan who was incredibly efficient and offered us an upgrade to a superior room for just 9 euros extra a night.. We snapped it up. He gave us maps of the city, showed us exactly where we were, advised us to walk everywhere to get the most out of the city and pointed us in the right direction for local restaurants within our budget. There are free (yes free!!!) safe deposit boxes at reception too. The room was spotless and modern having been recently refurbished. The maid service was terrific, they cleaned every day, changed the towels and the linen every day, it really was quite amazing, I expected the same sheets for at least 2 nights. Beds are comfortable and our rate included breakfast. The staff in the breakfast room are lovely and the Red Cafe where you take breakfast is very tastefully decorated. On offer for breakfast is bacon and scrambled eggs with grilled tomatoes, 4 kinds of bread, you can make your own toast, there is fruitjuice, cake, muffins, Serano ham, 3 types of cheese, yoghurt, and fresh bottled water. That list is not exhaustive by the way. There is something for everyone. The only fault I found was that the coffee is ABSOLUTELY DREADFUL!!!! I couldn't believe it. I expected excellent coffee in Barcelona at breakfast. It's one of those machine things that you press the button for the type of coffee you want. I have seen the same machines in Spring Hotels in Tenerife and had the same opinion. It really isn't nice, cannot be any cheaper than brewing good breakfast coffee and I do not know why hotels do it. Easy solution is to go to Starbucks on the corner opposite and get a takeaway or Cafe Vienna right next door do fantastic coffee, so all was not lost. We booked direct with the hotel who guarantee to give you a better price than anyone else and the whole reservation process was quick and easy. I made a special request for a double bed and a non smoking room and these requests were met and quoted to me on arrival....fantastic!! I work in the 5 star hotel sector, and I can tell you that special requests are not taken as seriously in the hotels that I am familiar with that cost 5 times what the Hotel Inglaterra costs. All I can say is, "Thank you Hotel Inglaterra, you delivered exactly what you promised, and more besides, please sort out that coffee machine!!!" We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: abcd1120
Reviews.Content: My two adult daughters and I enjoyed a clean, quiet and comfortable room in this centrally located hotel near Placa Catalunya. The room was not huge, but it was just fine as a base for our four night visit to Barcelona. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Another perk was the free wi-fi. The only slight inconvenience the lack of a safe in the hotel room, but safes (you are given your own key to your own box) are available behind the front desk. We decided to skip the hotel breakfast which seemed costly and just picked up a quick breakfast at a nearby Starbucks on our way out each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfect location, quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Martin1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Hotel Inglaterra. Location is ideal - right next to La Ramblas & Plaza Catalunya. No noise heard in our room at all from busy streets around hotel. Rooms are nice and comfortable. Lounge area is lovely for relaxing in and for a photo opportunity!! Only thing negative I could say is that hotel doesn't offer good choices for breakfast to certain people ie. we're from Ireland and wouldn't like Spanish breakfasts but there was no alternative? Still though, it's a super hotel and if you're thinking of staying here then I'd strongly recommend you do so. Nearby fountain is amazing, especially at night. Very near bus station which takes you direct to airport also, under 5 mins stroll away. Would def stay here again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice basic hotel, great location, room a bit on the small side”
Reviews.Author: bigpat29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 lovely days in Barcelona and chose this hotel on advice of friends. We took the breakfast package. Good points, great location for metro, bus routes shopping, and whole gothic area. Very nice breakfast and as much as we wanted good variety. Staff couldn't have been better, very helpful and informative. Points to consider. There was no kettle in room to make a cup of tea or coffee, that was a big let down, Although we were at back of hotel, our window faced onto a huge brick wall, little or no natural light, workmen were working close by a we felt and heard every bang of their hammers every day, rooms are barely big enough to swing a cat, however bathroom was spotless and sufficient. Would I go back to this hotel? probably not if I could find an alternative at similar price. However if there were larger room with a view out of the window then I would give it another go

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for seeing central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JAH43
Reviews.Content: Last week my wife and I had our third stay in about a year at the Hotel Inglaterra. Once again it fully met our expectations. We like the convenient location a 100 meters or so from the airport bus and we like its being at the edge of the old town (Barri Gotic) and Eixample. The street outside (Pelai) is a fairly busy one, but it's an INTERESTING busy street. As before, the service was crisp but it efficiently met our needs, and the staff seems friendly if just a trifle "distant.". It would have been nice to have free in-room wi-fi, but we were able to meet our email needs (and get also get a modest but cheap breakfast) at the Starbucks down the block. As for the important stuff, the rooms (and the whole property, really) give a feeling of being all clean and spic-and-span, the beds and bedding are comfortable, it's quiet upstairs and the shower in our bathroom (new?) was sumptuous. We definitely plan to stay at the Inglaterra the next time we're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A good location...but is it really value for money”
Reviews.Author: bouncingant
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Barcelona and having no real idea where to stay we decided to review a couple of options of TripAdvisor. We finally short-listed two or three hotels. What ultimately made us decide to pick Inglaterra was its excellent location and rooms that, in photos anyway, looked clean and tidy. On both these points we were not disappointed. For a novice to this beautiful city Inglaterra provided the ideal "home base". The La Ramba, Placa de Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia are all within easy walking distance from the hotel. The check-in was a quick and easy process and the staff were pleasant and professional. The rooms are on the small side, but well furnished, so on the whole no complaints there. I could mention the water stain on the bathroom wall behind the bath/shower...but this was a minor point in an overall cozy room. Some have made mention of the busy road Inglaterra is situated in. This really is not an issue when the balcony door is closed, so I would not worry about it too much. Overall the room fitted out purpose, so from that perspective the hotel was a good choice. Only two issues would stand out for me. Firstly, there is no Internet access in the room. Two terminals are provided next to the restaurant, but these days it is almost a given that Internet access would be available in your room. Secondly, although the breakfast provides a good selection, some work can be done to improve the quality. The grilled tomato was watery with nearly next to no taste and the scrambled eggs resembled a think chunky porridge. So this is one aspect of the hotel that I would skip. Better breakfast is to be had in the numerous open air cafes nearby. Finally, is the hotel value for money? As a three-star hotel I'd say that the daily rate is at the very top-end of what could be considered acceptable. Possibly you are paying for location, or maybe Barcelona is generally more expensive...those are really the only justifications that i can think of. Would I stay at Inglaterra again? I would say so, but now that I know Barcelona better I'd investigate other options as well before making the booking. Would I suggest the hotel to my friends and family? I think so...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RoyalCruiser
Reviews.Content: Having read the almost rave reviews in TripAdvisor, we were disappointed with this hotel. Since it is the sister hotel of the 5-star Hotel Majestic, also in Barcelona, we expected it to be more upmarket. Definitely not a boutique hotel and definitely a 3-star, not a 4-star. Check-in was quick and efficient and, upon a first glance, our room seemed O.K. However, as the photos show, upon a closer look it certainly didn't look as if it had been refurbished recently. Since we arrived at lunch time we decided to eat in the restaurant and were surprised to find that nobody spoke English or French. The menu was limited and the food was not very good. My husband ordered spaghetti and had to send it back twice because it was almost stone cold. Fast food and microwave ovens are obviously the norm rather than fresh food unfortunately. There was only one very small lift and that was extremely slow and tended to break down occasionally. This added to our discontent. However, the location is good and, as other reviews have stated, one is very near shops, restaurants, Las Ramblas and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: zottek
Reviews.Content: We have found this hotel as we wanted a hotel near Placa Catalunya, and we wanted to pay a reasonable price. We were very happy with the hotel. It is in a great location (2 minutes walk from Place Catalunya and La Rambla). The service was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful whenever we approached them on any issue. We stayed there 3 nights, and were very happy. The room we got had some dust in it (under the bed), and so we asked them to send someone, and they cleaned it immediately, even though the maid was just about to leave. We will definitely recommend and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Cash stolen from my room - Never again!”
Reviews.Author: MittensIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights in Aug '10 as a special treat for my 40th. I had heard so many warnings about safety and pickpockets in Barcelona that I was completely paranoid so I bought a flat money belt which I wore underneath my clothing. It's then so ironic this belt was stolen containing approx €400 cash from the 'safety' of my hotel room. Initally I thought I might have left it in another part of the hotel ie the sun terrace but when I retraced my steps I knew that it had gone missing from my room. I repeatedly put a "Do not Disturb" sign on my door so that the cleaners wouldn't come in yet every day they did. I returned to my room from breakfast one morning to discover the belt missing. I got a very bad response from the reception staff when I reported it missing. The man on reception just shrugged his shoulders. The manager wasn't available until for a few days by which time I would be at home. When I was checking out - the receptionist asked me if I had any items in the Safety Deposit Box behind reception - can you believe this! If I had been made aware of this facility in the first place, the theft may not have occured. I found another review where someone had their i-touch stolen from the room too. When I contacted the Manager by email - she implied that I was making this up and said she would need to see my police report before she could investigate further. I emailed this to her and she was going to contact her insurance company about the matter. Big Surprise! - No joy there. If this hadn't happened - I would be recommending the hotel as it's clean modern and well located but I'm left sickened by the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “completely satisfied from our stay in this nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greektravelers50
Reviews.Content: I am very glad to confirm that we are completely satisfied from our stay in this nice Hotel.All the personnel(reception,red cafe etc )were really very friendly and helpful to us.Also the room as well as all the areas of the hotel were very clean and the room was quicly and ver well made every day. Also the breakfast was nice with big variety of food. this was our first time in u hotel but for sure NOT THE LAST.we are travelling a lot having experience of hotels so please accept our sincere congratulations and thanks for all services offered to us We hope to have the opportunity of coming very soon in this nice city and hotel. Z P Greece

Reviews.Title: “somewhat overrated”
Reviews.Author: Shenandoah32
Reviews.Content: We stayed during a period where neither the heat nor the air conditioning worked. They had shut off the a.c. the week before because it "was cold". It was hot when we stayed - our room was lovely - the only room on the 6th floor but it was 82 degrees our first night. We had a nice porch - but it was next to the public deck/solarium - so it was very noisy if we kept the sliding door open - we had choice of heat or noise.... 2 men on the front desk were very helpful...one female was close to rude to more than one guest. (I heard more than one guest discuss this..) Although the accommodations were nice the items above would make me reluctant to recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want to be near La Ramblas but over-priced for a basic property”
Reviews.Author: gankor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located about a 5-minute walk from La Ramblas. We were given a room with a view facing the main road but found it too be noisy despite the double-glazed windows - we could hear the traffic outside all night. The room and bathroom were fairly small. We asked for a change of room for our 2nd and 3rd nights and were given a room at the back of the hotel - the room and bathroom were larger ( it came with a bath-tub ) and quieter in comparison. However, with the size of the hotel and thin walls, noise was now just from the corridor when other occupants opened and closed their doors. Service was efficient. Rooms do not come with safe deposit box. Our biggest complaint would be that the hotel does not provide free internet access during the length of your stay - it's for a limited period for the entire stay ( something like 1 hour for the whole stay ) and you have to go to the cafeteria to access. For a hotel billed as a "boutique" hotel, it certainly does not come across as such and we didn't find it value-for-money for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,clean,friendly professional staff....will be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmj_plumbing
Reviews.Content: Got to the Inglaterra hotel after a 2 minute walk from the bus stop in plaza catalunya and was greeted by a friendly English speaking member of staff who was very helpful telling us about the hotels amenities and also about the many things to do in Barca,also if you want to save a few euros dont book your breakfast online get it upon your arrival its 6 euro per-day cheaper! Was shown to our room which was perfect for our weekend stay,modern and clean with a nice comfortable bed with fresh towels every day. This was our first time in Barca and this hotel was the perfect location for all the transport links,bars and shops etc. Would definately recommend the Inglaterra to anybody you wont be disappointed!! Also stumbled upon a couple of fantastic lively bars that arent too expensive one called Schilling and a great little bar above a patisserie on Las Ramblas called Patagonia,two places you should check out!!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JohnM70
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were friendly and helpful and all able, in English, to direct and advise us of restaurants and make bookings for us when requested. The room was not large but comfortable and clean. The double glazed windows kept all street noise out and with the airconditioning sleeping was a pleasure. We stayed 5 nights with the breakfast option and found the breakfast adequate but with no variation. The location was excellent, close to the Placa de Catuluna and the Ramblas and the old city and north to the Eixample area. Definitely I would recommend this for a place to stay to see the sights in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and amazingly quiet for a good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: pilastri10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Inglaterra is a short walk from Plaza Catalunya but closer to the University metro stop. The friendly staff is very helpful and speaks English and some Italian. Breakfast is served every morning from 7-11am so you don't have to get up early. Besides, most tourist sites open at 10am, some at 9am.There was actually too much to choose from: cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, cold cuts, croissants, muffins, cookies, baguettes, toast and also 6 different hot meals like ham, eggs, bacon, potatoes etc. I got a reduced price with breakfast included so it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at this hotel last week, it was...”
Reviews.Author: izikulu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week, it was my first visit to Barcelona. I was told by a friend "it's a nice little hotel" and I must say I was very impressed. The rate I got was superb, the room was a fair size with everything you'd come to expect in a hotel room as well as an iPod speaker stand. The staff where great & very helpfull. Regina @ reception especially, she was amazing as she was always friendly & helpfull with my million & one questions that were all in English. The location was awsome! Right by the university which is very central for walking/bus/metro. Great value for money, I'd definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveKTFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights.Amenities are everything you need without being special,apart from the ipod docking station which was a very nice bonus. Staff were friendly and helpful,location is fantastic,and windows cut out any noise. Our room did not have a balcony,just a sheer drop onto the street,but sitting in the chair watching the word go by was very enjoyable. Would recommend and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: StarrCatcher
Reviews.Content: Location, location. Hotel Inglaterra is a great little hotel in a great location. It is just a few blocks to the Ramblas where all of the action is, but far enough away to get a good night's sleep. The rooms were typically small European hotel rooms, but comfortable and well appointed. Beds were firm,but comfortable. Bathrooms were large and clean. A minor complaint is no shower curtain, but a quarter glass panel that did not completely keep the floor dry. Our rate included the buffet breakfast which was good, but not outstanding. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. As typical our flight arrived early morning, so we arrived at the hotel by 10:00am. No problem. Our rooms were ready and we were allowed to check in. The hotel was close to the Metro and the tourist bus. You could walk to the shore at the end of Ramblas if you liked, but it would be a significant hike. Free WiFi was available for one hour each day in the business center or you could pay for WiFi in your room. We would highly recommend the Hotel Inglaterra for your Barcelona vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: CuriousMsM
Reviews.Content: The location was close to perfect. It's near two major metro stations, on a busy street but not as noisy as the major arteries. A five minute walk from the modern art museum, close walk to Las Ramblas. The internet works if you have your own equipment. - we didn't. They begrudgingly allow one free hour on the public units, but one "day" means until midnight. There is a wonderful internet/print shop less than five minutes away. The landmark for this hotel is Hotel Jazz - directly across the street. There are many affordable restaurants nearby - so skip the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel but with boring surroundings”
Reviews.Author: EllenQ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, clean and no complaints about the room. When we finally got the room we had reserved. We were put in a room without a terrace despite booking well in advance and making very clear that we did book a room with a private terrace. We had also e-mailed that it was our wedding trip. The manager offered us an upgrade but didnt seem to understand that the only reason we picked Inglaterra was because of the terrace room. That we actually had our honeymoon was totally ignored. After one or two nights we could move into the terrace room. We were offered two complimantary breakfasts as a compensation. (we stayed four nights) Room was very nice, terrace was fine - everything was clean, nice etc But the attitude was really nothing to recommend. The breakfast cost 14 euro - way too much for what we got. Location, pretty boring and not a cozy location considering Barcelona beeing such a great city. For a clean, nice hotel close to sightseeing its okej, but only if you make sure to make your way down to El born district for bars and tapas at night.

Reviews.Title: “The Dali room was modern, quite, bright and had its private terrace”
Reviews.Author: fabfab99
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the center of Barcelona this is the place to be. The Dali room was perfect for us as it is on the top of the hotel and is therefore very quite and bright. The bathroom has nice natural sunlight as well. The decor is modern and the room and terrace are spacious. There is a big LCD TV on the wall and a dock to play and charge your iPod/iPhone. Breakfast was nice and staff at reception very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for first timer in Barcelona; great location”
Reviews.Author: Amaklo
Reviews.Content: The location is near the top of the Rambla, but not too close so it's relatively quiet. We had a double room and a twin room, and both were spacious enough. The staff was pleasant. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate, and offered a good full breakfast including hot items (eggs, bacon/ham, waffles, bangers). It's an easy walk to the Rambla, the Plaza Catalunya and the Gothic Quarter, and it's close to the metro and major bus routes (which I recommend to take to Park Guell--the metro stop leaves you at the bottom of a long uphill walk to the park but the bus leaves you right at the entrance). I highly recommend the hotel, especially if you can get the breakfast included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and calm”
Reviews.Author: rosenfieldjack
Reviews.Content: This is our (wife and mine) first experience in a Barcelona hotel and were very pleased with our reception by the hotel staff, the cleanliness and "look" of the hotel, and the room itself. It is not a large hotel either in terms of floor space or number of rooms. There are I believe 6 floors serviced by an elevator and spiral staircase. One landing down from the street level lobby are toilet facilities (very clean) and a computer area with two computers for use by guests at a nominal charge ( 8 Euros for 45 minutes). One level lower gets you to the cafe where breakfast was being served when we arrived; a very nice assortment of cereals and breads, etc. We were early for our check-in so our luggage was stored in a locked closet used for that purpose. The very friendly and professional reception staff included Senorita Maribel and Senorita Montse; both ladies spoke English very well and could not have been nicer to us and to our needs. They represent very good ambassadors for the hotel. They gave us instructions on finding an ATM machine, and suggestions for sightseeing. We took a hop on, hop off bus tour for two hours (the receptionist Maribel was able to sell us the tickets helping us avoid time at the bus stop for that purpose). When we returned from the tour our room was ready and we were very happy to learn we had been given a free upgrade to a sixth floor small suite that included an outdoor patio. For dinner we went to a very nice restaurant, the Attic, recommended to us by Senorita Maribel and another staff member. It was about a six or seven block walk from the hotel. Our only complaints about the hotel are that there is no coffee machine in the room, and the cafe doesn't start morning service until 7:30 am, and our cab to the airport arrived at 7:40. We never had coffee or breakfast even though paid for as part of our fare. The living quarters while spacious had "poor" lighting. Not that there wasn't enough lighting, it's just that the overhead "can" lights aren't over you when in front of a mirror for makeup or shaving purposes. The shower glass partition was only about two feet or 30" so it was impossible to not get shower water on the bathroom floor. If checking out in the morning and you have a room on a "higher" floor, allow extra time for the one elevator to arrive. So, over all, we had a very nice experience made so by the efforts of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location, 2 mins walk from Plaza de Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: vivandcol
Reviews.Content: Don't know what we did to deserve the upgrade to the top floor Dali room, but thank you very much,it was great! Spacious & quiet room. Huge bed but ask for extra pilows.Plenty of towels and they were nice and big. Ipod dock in bedroom - don't forget adaptors for British plugs. Massive balcony with table, 4 chairs and 2 sun loungers. Just what we needed on a 2 day break to a busy city - a quiet spot outside to relax before setting out again. Reception staff were very helpful, spoke great English and appeared to treat all enquiries quickly and effectively. We booked room only so didn't try the food. Breakfast is expensive at 15 euro. Get off the airport bus at the Plaza de Catalunya, and it's 2 minutes from there. Barcelona is v v expensive at the moment! the cheapest cup of tea was from the airport on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, wonderful location and price”
Reviews.Author: trademanNewYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, near plaza Cataluña , close to the business center and well comunicated, plus a excellent quality atention and price.I highly recomend it for tourism or business

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiet in great location”
Reviews.Author: jazztravel21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and were offered the junior suite for an extra 15 euro a night. Was worth it. Spacious room and bathroom. It had a nice private balcony. The aur condition did not work but that was because of the season. We had to open the balcony door when it was too hot. The staff was friendly and helped in any question we had. The place is close is in walking distance to all major places in the center. The tour bus is near by. We took the aerobus from the airport (every 10 minutes) for 5 euro a person instead of a cab. You should go off at the university stop. Its one stop before the last (plaza catalunya) and a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Dont forget to ask for your free 45 minute wifi.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: eigon
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Barcelona and our enjoyment was enhanced by staying in a quality hotel. From the moment webooked to the time we left we found the staff helpful and pleasant. The location was perfect for us, close to all main amenities but peaceful at night. The room was excellent, clean with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom, if we had one minor issue it was the lack of tea making facilities in the rooom, a must when first waking in a morning. I will certainly use the hotel again for future visits and would recommend it without hesitation. Thank you for making our stay such a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is worth to have four stars”
Reviews.Author: OxKop
Reviews.Content: I like most of all: 1. Very comfortable bad with convenient pillows. 2. News TV chanels in English 3. Very closely to main sights of Barcelona. 4. pleasant atmosphere (furniture, solarium in the roof). 5. The room was warm (the weather was chilly). 6. Receptionists know English and very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Modern Furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Arubabride903
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Inglaterra Hotel for 3 nights in late March, and besides our window not shutting completely, I don't have any complaints. The location is wonderful...you are very close to las ramblas, and only a 5 min walk to plaza catalunya (the metro stop there can get you anywhere you need to go in Barcelona). Room was very clean, with modern, IKEA-looking furnishings and plenty of space. It's not 5 star luxury by any means, but considering the price, I was very happy with this place. Also, getting here from the airport was super easy - just take the aerobus to the "Universitat" stop, and the hotel is about 2 blocks away. To get back to the main barcelona airport, go to Plaza Catalyuna and pick up the aerobus A1, there is always one waiting. 5 euros each way - very good deal! The bathroom had plenty of towels, a hair dryer, and wasn't too small. There were also 2 closets for us to put our things, and a desk with a flat screen TV. Plenty of storage space. Only problem was that our window frame was a little warped, so it didn't shut completely. Therefore - we could hear the outside noise a little more than one normally would. If I was in barcelona again, i'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Promised so much but not quite delivered”
Reviews.Author: Minerva88
Reviews.Content: A few months after booking this hotel I noticed it was cheaper on their web site and wrote to them and they did promise to upgrade to a double deluxe room, but not to pay back the difference which I accepted. The room we were given was a poor standard and not deluxe. It was for a trip with my daughter and I felt rather embarrassed to be honest and didn't want to complain. The second day they said they had double booked and asked us if we would move? Then they changed their mind., after we had packed our things It was an ok hotel but nothing special for the high cost I paid . I

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel for staying in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: sophiewalker79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. Four friends, got a great price on lastminute.com, worked out at about £80 each for 3 nights in two rooms. Booked doubles on the website as this was the only option, however requested twins via email, and when we arrived, twins were sorted already! Hotel is clean, modern, and in a fabulous location, right near the central square in Bareclona. Both our rooms were small, rooms on 5th floor being slightly smaller than 2nd floor. Both perfectly adequate, clean and quite trendy in its finish, and comfortable. Didnt try food out at the hotel as were room only (local cafes, starbucks, and large supermarket in central square, all nearby for breakfast). There is a nice sun terrace at the top of the hotel. Short walk to everywhere in central barcelona, and short tram ride to the beaches, where the sea is really nice. We were only there 3.5 days, so we did the tourist bus tour, which surprsingly was really good! Worth doing if limited on time. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Small, elegant hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sdp2010
Reviews.Content: We got an "early bird" price, which was fabulous. We did not choose the "with breakfast" option. The location was perfect, close to everything we wanted to see and do. The decor is modern and understated. The marble bath was clean, clean lined and modern. The staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful. We couldn't have been more pleased, and will chose this hotel on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Hrvoje22
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, friendly staff, superb location just 200 meters from Placa Catalunya and La Rambla, special offer for breakfast buffet, trying to think if anything cons.....can't think of it, maybe rain during the last day of our stay in Barcelona :) I'll be back and recommend it to friends of mine! P.S. Don't waste your time to look for restaurants on your own, just ask at the reception and they'll send you to the right place, depends if you want to eat tapas, paellas, or something else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirlC
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location on a safe street which is within 5-10 minute walk to Pl. Catalunya, the airport bus stop, 2 metro stations and las ramblas. We had a warm, clean, modern room with plenty of space (room 508) and the bathroom had plenty of towels and hot water. We stayed room only and didnt eat in the hotel - breakfast was available at 15E each but there are plenty of nice coffee shops nearby that are cheaper. Staff were friendly and helpful with good English. Hotel Inglaterra was perfect for what we needed for our first trip to Bracelona - The only fault i could mention was that the bed was a bit hard for my liking but thats maybe just personal preference

Reviews.Title: “A really great place for a tourist in Barcelona to stay”
Reviews.Author: JAH43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a couple of minutes from the central Plaza Catalunya, and not much farther to the Boqueria (which has gotta be a foodie's delight), and right at the edge of the old-city neighborhoods that we were interested in. As an extra little bonus, the bus from the airport stops less than a block away (Universitat). This makes for a very easy 5 Euro trip, running with a schedule of about every 5 minutes. The furnishings were simple but comfortable and functional, and the facilities were modern. While we could hear a bit a street noise from time to time during the night, I can't really say it was bothersome. When we go to Barcelona, it's for the city and not for the room, which we merely want to be clean, attractive and inviting. All in all, we were really happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: frankiewhereru
Reviews.Content: Honestly, Hotel Inglaterra was a decent hotel, but nothing special or a place I would return. You get a room, a bed, a bathroom, the essentials. The staff were okay. They checked us in and smiled at us sometimes. The breakfast was not included and seemed a bit pricey. Tip if you pick this hotel: as you exit to the left, there is a bar/cafe/restaurant on the corner of the next street and is perfect for a quick, simple, and cheap breakfast. The people there were insanely friendly and the coffee and orange juice was fantastic. The location is alright if you love to shop, not very good for nightlife. The proximity to Las Ramblas was great, but at night everything was closed. Also, not very close to cultural sites either. Barcelona can be a walking city... if you love to walk. If you don't, this hotel will call for a lot of cab fares. Also, you never know what you'll get as far as views if that concerns you. My room had a great shot of a concrete wall, while another group of friends got one with a terrace. Ultimately, for the price I think you could find a better located, decorated, and staffed hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Better than home!!!”
Reviews.Author: lccCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Spain from South Africa. Hotel Inglaterra was just what was needed for a full of nonsense person like me that hates noice. (this is the first thing that worries me when booking a hotel) It was very quiet! The Hotel is beautifull neat & tidy, centrally located with very friendly and helpful staff. We were not disappointed!! Our room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The price was good for what you get. We felt very safe going out at night and the Ramblas is just around the corner. I am already saving for 2010 and can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SEKopite
Reviews.Content: For a first trip to Barcelona it was great. The location is just brilliant (3 minutes to everything, only 20 minutes by bus from Airport). The hotel is what it says, a 3 star, decent rooms, clean and staff was helpfull and friendly. Who has a problem with the price (we paid 414 E for 5 nights) should consider the positioning. Everything is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: laurene86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern and the room was lovely. It was right by la rambla and a great place to reach everywhere from. `the staff were very helpful, even recommending restaurants etc. This was my 5th trip to barcelona and this was the best hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella822
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Barcelona, it was important to have a centrally located, well-reviewed hotel with an English speaking staff. We were not disappointed. The staff is friendly, efficient and very helpful. Our room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. We had the hotel's buffet breakfast as part of our reservation. It was delicious! While the price was a bit more than I usually pay for lodging, it was worth it to have a hotel that met all of my requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: travella001
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. I went with my boyfriend and had a lovely room on the corner with two windows (211). Although it was quite a busy street the double glazing was great as we both slept brilliantly. The shower was really good (hot and powerful) nice towels, good breakfast, spacious VERY clean room. Staff really helpful and friendly too and the location was ace. Universitat and catalonia metros, ramblas, plaza catalonia within a 2minute walk. The only faults are that the room was got a bit chilly in the middle of the night. The staff assured me this was a temporary glitch with the fan and were very apologetic about it. I slept fine in reality so this was my boyfriends complaint! We also ordered a double room but got a room with two single beds made up seperately. With hindsight we probably should have just mentioned this to the hotel staff as they probably would have sorted it. All in all great hotel, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: mfnyc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Barcelona. We stayed in a superior room because I had read the standards are small, and most negatives here are from those who stayed in the standards. The room was on the small side by US standards, but I would say average for European. We had a queen bed and thought it was comfortable. The mattress is on the firm side, but that's what I prefer. The bathroom was a decent size with tub. We had a small balcony opening onto the main street (Palei). The location can't be beat. Walking distance to almost everywhere, and very near the Metro (and airport bus) stops at Placa Catalunya and Universitat. The staff was also very helpful, especially Maribel. We booked through the hotel website and breakfast was included. If it's not included it's probably not worth the 14E, but for us it was more than adequate. There's a great place to eat around the corner (exit right and make first right turn down the narrow street), called L'Oliva. It has the 3 lunch special for 12Euro (app, main, dessert and beverage). The food was very good and the portion large, especially the appetizer. The sandwich palce next door, Viena is also very good if you need a quick bite. Il Corte Ingles, near Catalunya, has a large grocery store section in the lower level where you can pick up snacks and beverages. There is a mini-fridge in the room stocked with the usual items, but we bought our own, and were able to fit water bottles in the fridge. We loved Barcelona, and this hotel was exactly what we hoped it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BRuss97
Reviews.Content: Inglaterra was an average hotel with a great location. Because this was an anniversary trip, I decided to spring for one of the special "suites"--we stayed in the Dali suite on the sixth floor which had it's own private "terrace." I had to admit that I was not terribly impressed with the room...the size was only average and the terrace was absolutely nothing special. In fact, if you actually wanted a view, you literally had to stand on a chair to see over the "fence" that surrounded the terrace. The beds are HORRIBLY uncomfortable. All that said, the location is fantastic...just a short walk to La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya, Metro Stops and tour buses. If you stay, go for one of the classic rooms--they're small by American standards, but they are just fine if you need someplace to sleep. Also...the breakfast that is available downstairs is most certainly NOT worth the 15 euros that they charge...go down the street to McDonald's instead! All in all, an average hotel in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: kescoto
Reviews.Content: Well situated near “the Ramblas”, restaurants, and transportation. Room was clean with a charming balcony. Room was small, which is typical European size. Staff was friendly and helpful (particularly Maribel). Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: 4travelmore
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights altogether, both before and after cruise. Very convenient to The Ramblas and City bus Tour starting point. Very friendly and helpful reception people when checking in and asking for directions, restaurant suggestions, etc. Rooms are typical European size, comfortable beds, clean, well appointed bathrooms. The full breakfast buffet was excellent. Internet connection at computer station was available for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: zoefje
Reviews.Content: The room was (210) not very big, the channels of the tv set where not all ok, could not watch the vuelta for instance .

Reviews.Title: “Minor drawbacks, major pluses”
Reviews.Author: Buny32132
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed when I first saw our room at the hotel - after about 15 hours traveling to get to Barcelona, I was in the mood for the spacious comfort of a 5 star hotel, not the little room with no view that greeted my eyes. But . . . the bed was comfortable, the shower terrific with great hot water supply, the air conditioner and heating was very effective, and the room was sparkling clean. Great towels, too. The staff spoke English and were very helpful, i.e., I needed a haircut and was directed to a nearby shop where I got a good haircut at a decent price. Breakfast was good with a nice variety of food. Room service was excellent. The location very central to all of the places we wanted to see in Barcelona, just off Ramblas with all of it's noise. I'd return in an instant. My only real carp is the huge step required to get out to our patio. In my exhausted state our first night, I forgot it was there and almost killed myself falling into the room. They should put a couple of steps there, or someone will be injured, quite seriously possibly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed! iTouch stolen - No safe in room :(”
Reviews.Author: chelseabellec
Reviews.Content: Hands down worst hotel experience to date.
