In short, my room did not have a safe, my iTouch (a cross between an iPhone and iPod) was stolen while I was out exploring the city, and the staff of Hotel Inglaterra were anything but helpful - they were downright rude. I let them know I'd be writing a review on Trip Advisor, and that it was a shame that they would let such a blatant incident of thievery occur within the confines of their hotel. Given the price of the room, they should expect their clientele to bring items that they would require a safe for.... Here's my story: Thursday, 1 PM: Checked in at Hotel Inglaterra for a 4 night stay... showered, arranged for internet service (very expensive!), quickly left to explore the city. Thursday, 9 PM: Returned to hotel to shower, left for a rather late, yet delicious dinner. Thursday, Midnight: Returned to hotel, brought iTouch downstairs because internet was not connecting to hotel network. Man at front helped me to get it to connect, he thought the iTouch was a pretty cool gadget. I sent an email to my boyfriend from my room, and to sleep I went... Friday, 10 AM: Left room in neat condition, hadn't unpacked completely, noticed room did not have safe but that refrigerator had lock (weird!?), so locked passport and credit cards in fridge). Excited for 1/2 day bike tour, only brought camera (put $ in camera case), and left iTouch on bed, along with various other items (pack of tissues, chap stick, gum, etc... which i couldn't bring with me biking - nobody brought bags!). Friday, 6 PM: Returned to hotel - bike tour was amazing and the tapas we had after were delicious. Beds were made, and items from bed moved to side table. iTouch gone! Shocked, I ripped apart the room... unpacked my entire bag, lifted up mattresses, searched every inch of the room. Alas, the iTouch was nowhere to be found. I calmly called the front desk and reported the incident. I was told that she would leave a note for the cleaning staff and would receive a call regarding the item the following day. She explained that sheets are not changed daily, that they merely make the beds (I initially thought maybe it had been accidentally swept up with the sheets... but this clearly was not the case). I asked to speak with the manager, but she was not on duty. I also asked when the man who previously helped me with the iTouch would return to the hotel, and was told he only worked Thursday nights (WEIRD!!). Saturday, 10 AM: Before leaving hotel for Parc Guell, stopped at front desk to discuss incident, was told that nothing was found. Saturday, 5 PM: Returned to hotel to clean room, and again ripped it apart searching for the iTouch. I told myself that whoever stole it would return it... knowing that their job was on the line... After realizing it was still gone (stolen....), I called the front desk... the woman working at the desk, who spoke great english, said she would send up the maid who cleaned the room on Friday. The maid arrived shortly, but did not speak english at all... she showed us how she cleans the room, and how she moves everything from the bed to a side table or to the desk. Clearly, she was not going to incriminate herself if she had taken it. I called back downstairs and had the front desk woman translate over the phone what the maid was explaining. I asked to speak with a manager again, but was told that the manager would not be in until Sunday morning. Sunday, 9 AM: Before leaving for the day, I stopped by downstairs to ask what steps would be taken next, repeated my story, and received a nonchalant response: "We trust our employees and there is nothing more to discuss. We will let you know if it turns up..." How would it turn up?! Monday, 9 AM: Check out time. Front desk staff was rude rude rude... nonchalantly dismissed the incident... and went on their merry way. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service - No AC in Dali Room; No Windows in Gaudi Room”
Reviews.Author: lwhitmandc
Reviews.Content: Dali Room – Would have be nice if the air conditioning worked: We ended a 10 night trip with three days in Barcelona, so I decided I wanted to splurge for a nice room. After a lot of research, I decided on Hotel Inglaterra; it had great reviews. I booked the Dali Room at 249 Euro per night (about US$360/night), because it looked like this room has a rooftop patio. We arrived on September 4 for 3 nights. The room was great, and the patio was much nicer than I had even anticipated. While unpacking, we noticed that the room seemed warm, which I’d expect for a room on the top floor of the building. I checked the fan/thermostat; while the register felt cold, the fan was not working. There were three settings on the fan: low, medium and high. When switched to either low or medium, there was no air flow and no fan sound; when switched to high, the fan did come on, but there was still no air flow. So, while the ac did work (as the register felt cool), it was useless without a fan to blow the cold air into the room. I went to the desk to ask for assistance. The attendant told me that the ac did work, but that it just required a longer period of time for it to cool down. I explained that the fan did not work, and was told again that I just needed to give it time. So, we left the room for 3 hours, leaving the fan and ac on high; we closed the curtains so the room was dark. When we returned, the room temperature was 82 degrees (according to my iPhone app). I then returned to the desk and was told the manager would come up. (I think her name was Francesca?) The manager felt the register, which was cold, and told me it was working. (I own a number of corporate apts in the U.S., and know a lot about about HVAC units.) I knew the fan did not work, so I then told the manager that clearly it did not work, if the room would not cool down when the ac was on high for 3 hours -- windows closed and curtains drawn. The manager then agreed that the room was too warm and said that she would have someone to check on it. I heard nothing, so a couple of hours later, I went down to the desk to ask for her. The manager then told me that the maintenance person had checked the unit and it was working properly . I asked her if I could explain the issue to the maintenance person, but she told he had left for the weekend. I then asked if we could move to another room, and she told me the hotel was fully booked, but that she would give a discount and move us to another room on the next day. I understand that was all that could be done… so, we slept with the windows open to get a breeze. The room was uncomfortably warm. The thing that bothered me most, is that they (manger and front desk attendant) kept trying to tell me that it was working correctly, although the temp was 82 after cooling for three hours. While I tried to explain the issue was with the blower, they just didn’t seem to listen or care. Basically, I expect some ac when I pay US$360 per night. Gaudi Room – No outside access; window are sealed shut. On Saturday, we were told that we had to vacate our room by noon, in order to move to the new room. We were going to do sightseeing, but we needed to wait around until noon, as the desk clerk told us that they would not move the luggage; we had two suitcases a backpack and a computer bag. Humm. We waited to move our luggage in to the new room at noon, while it was still being cleaned. We were very happy to get a room with ac, and the Gaudi room did have working ac. However, do note, unlike Gaudi’s appreciation of nature, this Gaudi Room was sealed up like a drum!.. No outside space; the windows were sealed shut. So, if you want to open a window, or step onto a balcony, do not book this room. However, It is a very nice size, and the air conditioner does work. Elevator out of order Actually, it’s a good thing we moved from the top floor to the 1st floor, because when we packed up to leave, the elevator was out of order. I waited on level 1 for a ride to -1 , which never came; no problem, it was only two flights down. There was a sign on the elevator on the main floor, but no signs on the other floors. (I guess it would have been asking a lot for the desk staff to place a note on each of the floors.) Anyway, moving the luggage down one flight was pretty easy. Our first room was on the 6th floor, and so I would have been really bummed. 10% discount for rooms without Air conditioning? Upon checkout, I encountered the same desk attendant who had initially told me that the ac just needed more time to work. I asked her about the discount, and she again told me there was nothing wrong with the ac. I reminded her that the hotel manager did acknowledge that the room was too warm and had told me there would be discount (although they continued to tell me there was no problem with the air conditioning.) She said she would give a 10% discount for that night. Basically, I can pay, and it’s OK. But, 10% is an insulting compensation for sweating overnight in my $360 room; she then went to 15%. How generous! Internet Charges. The charge was 30 Euros for three nights. On checking out, the desk attendant told me that she had waived the Internet charge, as if I were complaining too much about the air conditioning … and I should be content with that. However, the 30 Euro charge was still on the statement. I travel a lot in the U.S., and Internet charges are a big pet peeve of mine. If a hotel wants to charge $360 for a room without ac, it seems a bit galling to charge another 30 for internet. Overall Reaction? If something goes wrong, don’t expect caring service from this hotel. As a contrast, we’d just spent four nights in Rome, where the staff from A to Z were super nice and welcoming. Hotel Inglaterra (or at least the manager and our front desk clerk), were not helpful or caring. I really wouldn’t recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rinceri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Friday Aug 21st to Sunday Aug 23rd 2009 for a long weekend. Having intially booked another hotel much further out but managed to get it changed in time before we arrived, we were delighted with the location of Hotel Inglaterra. For tourists who want to be centrally located, this hotel is ideal. It's only a few minutes from the top of the Ramblas at Catalunya Square which is one of the main tourist thoroughfares with a myriad of street performers and stalls selling anything from trinkets to small animals and birds. We arrived at the hotel extra early and were informed that we were being upgraded to a deluxe room. To be honest, I think the only difference between that and a superior room was access to a private outside patio-type area. The room was lovely, nice big bathroom and all the usual amenities. Good choice of breakfasts in the morning. Room was made up every day when we were out. When back late, we didn't haave to ring a bell to get, there's someone on the front desk 24/7. When leaving on the Monday morning, we were able to store our luggage until that evening as we had a late flight back to Dublin. Overall, the location was great - we could come back to the hotel if necessary to drop off stuff etc. Also, very close to the tour buses and metro station at Catalunya Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value * Good location * Good holiday *”
Reviews.Author: AandB2009
Reviews.Content: 24-28th August 2009.-The Hotel is well situated in being just far enough away from the hustle & bustle of the “Las Ramblas”, yet close enough to walk to. The hotel staff were pleasant and spoke good English. The room albeit quite small, was clean and adequate; the sheets and towels were changed every day of our 4 day stay. The room comprised of a desk TV small cupboad, Mini bar, there were doors openig onto a tiny area with 2 chairs and small table but was in an inner corridor with little natural light. We did ask for an upgrade but were told the hotel was fully booked. The air con was quiet and most welcoming. The Breakfast buffet dining area was nicely decorated and the food was good with a very good selection of hot & cold food and attentive staff. I would advise everyone who is not a lottery winner to give the bar a wide birth as a Vodka & Coke and a Whisky was 22Euros (a bottle of Jamesons was 13 euros in the corner shop). The biggest let down was the noise from the adjoining fast food restaurant, with furniture being dragged along the floor both late at night (10.30 pm) and very early morning (07.30 am). all in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: HMSMATEY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for the 2 nights we stayed at Barcelona. The value was great, much cheaper than most other hotels and with breakfast which was excellent. Service, location and the room was superb and was a much better experience I have had from hotels with greater stars and price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: tglover
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the location of this hotel is excellent and allows for easy tranport to and from the airport via the aerobus to Placa universidad and back to the airport from Paca Catalunya. The two women at the hotel front desk who helped us were friendly and very informative. They have a safe where you can lock up your valuables for free and for small charges you can use the one computer they have for internet. Breakfast buffet in downstairs dining area is good enough though the eggs there were always cold. We really liked the style and decor of the rooms. The A/C was great to have because the city was so hot. Bathrooms were well equipped and nice and beds comfortable and firm mattresses. Our rooms were quiet as well. There was no fitness room or people to help you with luggage or a separate concierge per se, but we didn't really need those things so were fine without them. We liked this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to return to it. As for other things, we highly recommend Ciutat comtal (i think that is the name) above Placa CAtalunya on Ramblas for great tapas and a lively scene. We did not particularly like the flamenco show at the place several others mentioned in their reviews (it is on Ramblas as well) though we only went' for the show and not the buffet. We recommend Les Quinze Nits at Place Real for a nice and reasonable meal in a lovely setting). All the Gaudi monuments and sites are really worth taking the time to see!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre-cruise. The location is very good to the Ramblas and the market as well as other sites. The rooms are small and simple/modern but clean. We never could get the air conditioner to work properly so it's highly recommended to get an upper room with a balcony or patio. The split twin beds pushed together was a bit of a challenge when trying to sleep together as the beds would slide on the wood floor and seperate. The breakfast in the morning was hit or miss (disgusting cold and runny scrambled eggs one morning) but enough choices to at least have a meal to start the day. We found trying to find a nice place for dinner was a bit challenging in the area. Staff were nice but not overly friendly. Overall there are probably better choices in Barcelona but the rates are good and frankly we didn't stay in the room that much as there is too much to see and do in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1402
Reviews.Content: The Inglaterra Hotel was brilliant. It is a stones throw away from Playa Catalunya. The staff were very friendly & helpful. I had a problem with the shower hose which was efficiently sorted. The room and bathroom was a lovely size, couldn't fault the cleaners, the air-conditioning worked very well. The buffet breakfast catered for everyone & was lovely, you could get room service or go to the restaurant all the meals were good that we had. We would definately go back there again. This hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coombe99
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to previous reviews. Nice clean small hotel within easy walking distance of all the places you want to visit. Breakfast was fine, reasonable choice. The rooms are very small though so if thats a problem you might want to try more expensive ones, but we were out sightseeing all day so didn't mind. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Can recommend as gay friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Might be a gamble, its true the aircon doesn't work, superb breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 3fussytravellers
Reviews.Content: I booked the suite at the top of the hotel (at great expense!), so my friends and I could share drinks in the evening together, as it has it's own terrace. Unfortunatly this terrace was rather grubby, had no plants, umbrella or lighting (that's all it needed to make it a real treat) and didn't overlook Barcelona, but railings/industrial rooftops. This didn't matter too much, I simply rang down and asked for the staff to sort things...could they bring up some candles and an umbrella perhaps? They said they couldn't. I was really disappointed - and quite flabberghasted that a day later (when the staff had changed) that they immediately did all these things and apologised they hadn't prepared the room properly. We had a great evening out on the terrace, the staff even brought up an extention cable so I could bring a lamp outside so we could see each other. I did feel some money off would have been suitable - afterall, we only stayed for 3 nights and for 1 of them we couldn't enjoy the terrace we paid for. So it seems staying here MIGHT be a gamble as it depends upon which staff member is in charge. The manager who was in charge when we arrived didnt really know what he was doing (maybe new?). He was sweet enough though, even while admitting the aircon never works! Fortunately lovely Barcelona isn't too hot at the beginning of April. We did have a good time and the rooms are clean, decor good, bathrooms nice. My friends stayed in normal double rooms, which weren't spacious, but quite nicely decorated. There is no doubting the hotel is in a FANTASTIC position, and I cannot fault the very excellent breakfast. This is not a bad or shoddy place so maybe you should simply check before booking that your own requirements will be met?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inglaterra Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PamjoHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Inglaterra (11th - 15th May 2009) and I chose this hotel because of its location and reasonable on-line room costs (99 euros inc. breakfast). We were a group of 8 people aged 60-70 and we had 4 rooms in total. Our room was 512 (5th floor) and had a balcony overlooking the street - Carrer de Pellai which is midway between Placa Universitat and Placa Catalunya. When we arrived, we got off the aerobus at Placa Universitat and walked the short distance (diagonally right) to the hotel. We boarded at Placa Catalunya for the return journey. The room had air conditioning and the toilet facilities were clean with a large walk-in shower. It was nice to have access to the balcony and once the door was shut, the street sounds were in- audible. During our stay, Barcelona won the Copa del Rey (their equivalent of the FA Cup) and after watching the 2nd half which was televised in the Placa Catalunya, we were able to watch the celebratory parade from our hotel balcony. Our friends in an adjacent room closed their balcony door and slept right through! Safes are available in reception and we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel on our last day until our evening flight. This was another bonus to having the hotel near the Placa Catalunya. We bought a 2 day ticket on the Orange/Red Tour Bus and spent the first day viewing the sights from the top deck, changing from the Red Route to the Green Route in order to see everything. Once we had got our bearings, we spent the second day hopping on and off in order to visit specific locations. We did see one incident of a wallet snatch in the park opposite the Sagrada Familia. Two young girls carrying a clipboard were asking for money. When an elderly gentleman stopped to read the notice and took out his wallet to give them some money, they snatched it and ran off. This was the only time we witnessed an incident of this kind. The girls had previously approached my friend and I whilst we were sitting on the bench waiting for our husbands but we simply told them to go away. As everyone says: Barcelona is no different to other cities. Just be on your guard and try not to make yourself a target. We walked down Las Ramblas late at night and had no problems although I would warn tourists not to venture too deeply into the area of Raval where there are many "dodgy" side streets, especially after dark. All in all, we had a fantastic 5 days in this vibrant and beautiful city and would have no hesitation in going back to the Hotel Inglaterra.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: rdm68
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure staying here for 3 nights. It's a boutique-style hotel - sleek, modern and clean, and very comfortable. The front desk was amiable and helpful. A good breakfast was included, served in a bright, pleasant environment. Conveniently located, too. A great choice for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but okay staff”
Reviews.Author: CitySlicker07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and near almost everything, very convient to get to by bus to and from the airport and all around barcelona. Rooms are clean and actually a decent size compared to European standards. Staff was okay, not overly friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel since for its value and location and cleaniness. Other than that there's nothing more to this hotel. Also because its of its location certain rooms might be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and accessible”
Reviews.Author: kwitis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days before a mediterranean cruise. Me and my husband love this hotel, it's very close to the center of the city. We took the Aerobus from the airport, very cheap 4.50 euros one way, the ride was only half hour to Universitat stop, once you get off the bus, look straight and you will see the hotel sign. Check in was easy, room nice and clean, a little small but very comfortable. Breakfast was included, nice restaurant, enough food with scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, bread, coffee, fruit...We bought tickets for 2 days on hop on hop off bus, very nice way of going around the city, we saw a lot of attractions. The hotel is very convenient especially after a long day of strolling the city. At night we go to the famous las ramblas for dinner, we went to Taverna Basca Irati for good tapas and don't miss the flamenco at Tablao Cordobes, good buffet, drinks and show. During the day, go to the La Boqueria market for very good fruits and nice restaurant Pinoxto Bar. Barcelona is such a nice city, wish we had more time but hopefully we can go back there soon. We checked out at 9 am but left our luggages in their luggage room and spent the whole day roaming the city, we came back to get them around 3 pm and took the taxi right outside the hotel to the port for 18 euros. We had a very good time in Barcelona and we will certainly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location but no amenities”
Reviews.Author: PHFlorida
Reviews.Content: Upgrade to the deluxe room as others are very small with tiny bathroom. Our 1st room had a constant, vile odor coming from the bathroom. They said that some of their rooms on the first floor in the front have this problem when it rains.. (the Barcelona sewer system backs up, etc.) They changed us to a nicer room with no odor issues -- we should have spoken up on day one. They charge you to use the one hotel computer and it has no printer. Hotel breakfast is decent for the money. Most staff courteous-- one guy at front desk always seemed irritated. Location is best attribute of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ribrabrobro
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights at the Inglaterra. The hotel was exactly what we wanted. The location is perfect, walking distance to everything. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good if included in the room price as ours was, but probably expensive if it isn't. We had a room at the back which was quiet and comfortable, except that we had twin beds instead of a queen or king. We decided not to ask for a different room because we were happy with what we had. All in all this was a perfect hotel for our needs and I would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: yudesi
Reviews.Content: After having bad experience in another hotel I moved to this hotel and can't write enough about the hotel, incredible staff and location of this hotel. Highly recommend to anyone who is planning to travel to Barcelona and looking for a 3 star accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: EMc2England
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of weeks ago and it couldn't have been better. Nicely designed, clean and close to everything we needed. We wanted one double and one twin room and they were great in sorting this out for us. Breakfasts were fantastic - much better than the usual 'breakfast included' option. We got a good deal too by booking and paying in advance on their early bird scheme. Go for the superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JemezPatti
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on our first visit to Barcelona. I agree with other reviewers that a Superior room is worth the extra cost. I was happy to see wood laminate flooring instead of carpeting which often can't be cleaned very thoroughly. I wish our bed hadn't been two twins pushed together, but at least we could share a bed. The water pressure in the shower was wonderful, but mysteriously, we were subject to very brief blasts of cold water about 3-4 times during the course of a normal 5-minute shower. Strange! We enjoyed the 8 Euro breakfasts; the cappucino was very good. Staff was very helpful and accommodating to our questions. We had room 508 which had a small balcony. It was great to be able to let fresh air in through the French doors although it also let in the street noise. We enjoyed the rooftop terrace but would have liked to provide our own beverages rather than purchase from the hotel. Location is excellent: close to Las Ramblas and two Metro stations as well as the Bus Turistica which can give you a great overview of what Barcelona has to offer, allowing you to stop where you want and get back on the bus later. The bus doesn't run very late in the evening, however, so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel, excellent location but noisy at front”
Reviews.Author: Mal42
Reviews.Content: Very clean Hotel close to The Ramblas, the tourist buses and many eating places. Excellent service from staff. Our room was very comfortable, was at the front and noisy at night. Breakfast available in the basement restaurant with good selection of hot and cold food for 8 euro. Warning. Beware of pickpockets in Barcelona. We were targeted twice during our 5 day visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a fab find!”
Reviews.Author: debs007girl
Reviews.Content: Took my husband here for his 40th birthday & what a fab find!The hotel is conveniently situated between Catalunya Square & Universtat station. Walked to most places. Would definately return. Clean, stylish hotel. Good breakfast, staff just sooo friendly & informative. Wished we could have stayed longer. Check-in & check-out swift & efficient. Only fault was traffic noise, but then we expected that being in city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Indulge In The Inglaterra”
Reviews.Author: LindaA45
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay at The Inglaterra which included breakfast. We arrived at 10.30 am and the room was ready which was great. The room itslef was very clean (and cleaned daily) and had everything you need, including a fabulous shower! The choice at breakfast was excellent , my only quibble was that the 'hot' choice was never actually hot. The staff on reception were all very helpful, when we arrived in Barcelona they had had very bad gales and the towers at the Sagrada Familia were closed - each morning the receptionist rang up for us to see if they had opened which was very helpful. The hotel is very handily placed for Las Ramblas and most attractions and for public transport. Although on quite a busy, working street we did not have any problmes with noise and I would recommend this hotel to everybody..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in lovely area”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller06
Reviews.Content: the hotel is wonderful. make sure you see a flamenco show while you are in barcelona. ask for a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CasaSulo
Reviews.Content: We arrived as a mature couple for a three day break and the staff were friendly, polite and spoke excelent English. Having said that the hotel rooms did not come up to 4* more like a 3*. The first room we were offered was a twin with good view - but a twin. The second was a double with about 45cm (18") either side of the bed! We settled on the third room, D/ble, view of the busy street below and Juliet balcony. The room was comfortable, the bed suited us but it was on the hard side. There were no tea/coffee making facilities but we have experience of Spanish / continental hotels so we take our own travel kettle etc. with us. We did find the system about the "sun roof terrace" rather bizarre; there was no bar and the reception had to organise drinks etc for you and there is a large notice stating - Only food and drinks purchased from the hotel can be consumed - The breakfast was of a simplistic continental style with plenty of choice for all but rather expensive as an "extra" to the daily rate but convenient. The hotel is very close - 3/5 mins. walk of The Ramblas, Placa de Catallunya, cafes and shopping. We would reccomend the tourist tour bus €20 each but it does give a headset commentary and saves hours map reading. There is an internet in the hotel but we found a local internet cafe for a couple of Euros for one hour spread over our three day visit. On departure our flight had been delayed and the hotel allowed us to vacate the room and store our luggage in a safe holding room. Barcelona is very expensive and watch out for pick-pockets but we would recommend everybody visit it for the experience. We took the airport bus for €4.50 caught at the airport but get off at Placa Universitat for Hotel Inglaterra BUT you have to catch the return journey at Placa Catalunya which worked out great and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A very good trip!”
Reviews.Author: Molly067
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night city break with my daugther. The hotel was in an excellent location right in the city centre and within easy walking distance from Las Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya where the aiport bus drops you off and picks you up from. This was definately an added bonus as it was just a short walk away to the hotel, also a very reasonable price of just 4€05 each way. The hotel was very clean and staff were very helpful and friendly. We were very lucky to have our room upgraded so we had a large room and was modernly furnished. As mentioned in previous reviews it is cheaper to pre book your breakfast the night before as this cost 12 euros instead of 14 on the day. There was plenty of choice from the buffet. I would recommend going on the touristic bus as it is an excellent way to see the city, it is better value to get a two day pass as it is only 5€ cheaper than the one day pass. If i was to return to barcelona I would definately stay at this hotel again or recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CLHughes
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights post cruise at this wonderful property. As mentioned in previous reviews, the hotel has a contrast of personalities-old world exterior, sleek , modern interior. We pre-paid for our room, which allowed for a generous discount on a Superior Room. The earlier you book, the lower the rate. We paid 135 Euro per Superior Room per night incl. all taxes and fees. A terrific rate considering the location and accomodations. Our room, 201, was very generous in size, sleek, modern, almost Pottery Barn like. A large door opened to a small balcony overlooking the street below. The bathroom was large and modern, with good shower pressure and hot water. A 24 in.flat screen TV had several English speaking channels including SKY News. The triple glazed windows kept out the noise from the street. The location can't be beat Steps to Las Ramblas, Hop On/Hop Off bus, Placa de Cataluna and metro stops. Hint: If using the HO/HO buses, bring your own comfortable earphones or headsets. The one' s offered on the bus fit improperly. We took advantage of a discounted breakfast offering in the downstairs restaurant. Very good selection of hot and cold offerings, and unlimited espresso, cappuccino, and coffee. At this point on our trip, we paid extra for the convenience of breakfast rather than searching out a better deal. Staff, for the most part were very helpful and courteous. The Manager even came out to give me all the latest suggestions on new dining venues. All in all, a GREAT stay. We definitely will be back, and will tell as many as possible about this wonderful Barcelona gem.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, immaculate with great location”
Reviews.Author: overmyal
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, which is located a very short and interesting walk from the Placa de Catalunya. The front desk personnel were welcoming and gave wonderful recommendations for neighborhood restaurants and touring options. The neighborhood is near a university and we always felt safe even when out in the early morning. The architecture of many nearby buildings is Modernista and gorgeous. We will definitely re-book on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: staffie2001uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a traditional look on the outside, but is very modern inside. Our room was on the front with a little balcony overlooking the street that ran down to Playa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. Spacious bathroom with a good shower, over the bath, complemented the wood floored bedroom. Air-con worked well and quietly. Digital LCD TV with a couple of English news channels. They had a two for one deal on breakfast while we were there so it was €7 per person for the all you could eat buffet. Well worth it with a good selection of cooked and continental items.

Reviews.Title: “city break”
Reviews.Author: mini9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, only a 2 minute walk to the rambles which is the main tourist area. It was clean and modern and the safe were very helpful. We got a good deal on lastminute.com, it was a room only basis but there is lots of places around that does cheap breakfast. The only bad thing I would say is that the room was a bit small and there are no safes in the room, but we could all cope with that. Highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rebecz456
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Inglaterra and we had a fantastic time! The blue airport bus (A1) from the airport to the placa catalunya is definitely the best way to get there and its just a short walk up to the hotel from there (make sure you have the street name handy - and check the lamp post maps for which street to walk up!). When we arrived to check in the reception staff were really friendly and spoke a good standard of English we were checked in within a few minutes and in our room which was perfect we only went with the very basic cheapest one and thought it would be very small but there was plenty fo space for us and our two suitcases. The air conditioning was a god send and the bathroom was by no means small and very clean. The location of the hotel is fantastic for wherever you wish to visit. (For a fantastic pint of guiness check out scobies which is just round the corner). The terrace was lovely although the bar is actually on the basement floor but there is a phone up there to order drinks and snacks and the staff bring them up to you - also the prices for a hotel is more than reasonable. Overall it was a brilliant stay and a fabulous hotel and we would definitely stay there again! (although the hotel across the road had a pool on the roof that looked very inviting lol but you cant have everything)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, highly recomend it!!”
Reviews.Author: jetset-wannabe
Reviews.Content: I'll admit i was unsure when my girlfriend suggested this hotel, I wanted to spend more on a 'better' hotel......How wrong I was. Hotel Inglaterra was everything we needed and more. We arrived 2 hours prior to check-in and were found a room straight away, the room was a decent size with good wardrobe space, decent sized bathroom and a fully stocked mini bar (which we didi not use but it was a reasnable price) The location is one of the best with the Ramblas only a min away and a lovely short walk down to the water front. Loads of places to eat and far too many to mention however about half way down the ramblas on the left is a courtyard with resturants lining its out side, I would recomend this area it was busy yet once at your table you can sit and watch the street performers and the word go by. My 2 top tips for any stay at hotel Inglaterra are, Have a lazy day on the roof terrace, its a lovely place and you can order room service to the roof - Potatoe Bravas and 2 beers only 11 euros which is reasonable. The second is to sight see via the bus touristic, it's 26E for 2 days and opperates on a hop on hop off basis. It is opened top and includes headphones for your own guided tour (very touristy-looking but a great way too explore at 1 fixed cost) the bus departs fron the square at top of the Ramblas but if you catct it opp the hotle on the corner you will beat the massive que at the square and are nearly certen a top deck seat. The tour vists all majior attractions including gaudi works, port olympic, nou camp and loads more - its a must if you have the time. Go for this hotel and you will be happy - just remember pick pockets are everywhere, DON'T LET THIS RUIN YOUR TRIP its a fact of life in Barca - Just be vigilant, and remember if somebody stops you to say you have gum or bird poo on you, this is a scam they WILL try to steal things from you!!!!! But please don't be put off Barca is a great place to visit, this was my second trip in 5 months and I would still go back this year if i could! Happy hol's

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: Scottraveller6
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed in here in july 08 for three days, we were more than pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel. The building is an old elegant building with a lot of original character but with modern furnishings. Reception staff were very helpful and gave us maps and other useful information on tours and attractions. We wern't disappointed with the rooms either, dark wooden flooring, neutral decor, modern furnishings. The room was lovely, and very clean, beds were comfortable. We were lucky to have a room over the main street with french opening doors and a small balcony. Bathroom was nice with a good shower. Location was a big plus just a five min walk to las rambas and many places to eat and drink. Central location to all major sights and designer shopping!! Hotel is a 2min walk to le courte englais which is a large department store, which outside you can get the airport bus to the airport for 4.10 euros which takes about 35 mins, the buses come every 5mins. I would recommend this hotel, it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “excellent property, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kenmaestro
Reviews.Content: I wonder whether some of the reviewers have actually stayed in this property but it really was a 'find'. The hotel has a great location on Pelai, just 100 mtrs from the airport bus stop (Placa Universitat - last stop before Catalunya). It is one of several 'boutique' size properties on this street that have been refurbished with varying standards of success. The Inglaterra has been done VERY well. I had asked for a quiet room and was a little concerned to be given a room on the 1st floor on the front. I had no need to be as the new triple glazing (or maybe gas filled double glazing) excluded all but the rare distant sound of a horn. The air-con was good - not too severe - and the general comfort level and stylish decor of the room excellent. Breakfast (included) is served in the lower ground floor breakfast room with an ample basic continental breafast to start the day. The roof terrace was a delight. It was a great place to go and hang out and the hotel were most accommodating in providing a good size ice bucket and glasses in order to enjoy a glass of wine in the late afternoon. The location is perfect - you are 5 minutes walk from Catalunya, Gracia and the top of the Ramblas and yet in a slightly less frantic setting than being mid-Ramblas. The Museum of Contemporary Art (MACBA) is 5 minutes walk and the entire area of El Raval is wonderful to explore with great street markets are 'real' life. I stayed at the hotel with a group of friends and so we had six rooms of varying shapes and sizes but all were excellent quality and ideal for a stay in the city. If you are looking for large motel size rooms this isn't the place for you (but why would you be!). I would certainly stay again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends and TA members.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: Fiohna
Reviews.Content: Stayed her with my mum and sister and we had a good comfy triple room with plenty of room for 3 which was nice. Food at breakfast was ok but not fantastic. Reception staff very friendly and helpful 24/7. Hotel is easy walking to buses or just onto Las Ramblas for the shops and street entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: InterestedDublin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Inglaterra from 7th to 11th of May and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Barcelona. The airport bus costs €4 and leaves you at the Placa Catalunya which is just a stonesthrow from the hotel. Our room was on the first floor at the front of the hotel and although a little on the small side it was modern and clean, it had a very nice bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. There was some traffic noise but we managed to sleep well. We returned on two of the four days at 5pm to find our room hadn't been cleaned, we were told that we should have hung the "please clean the room" sign on the door so it might be an idea to do so if you are going to stay there. Breakfast is not included and costs €10 if pre-booked at reception or €14 if you arrive last minute. There is a wide choice for breakfast and it is well worth €10 but we also paid a visit to the local market just off Las Ramblas where we bought fresh fruit and juice and we ate our breakfast in the sunshine. I highly recommend Hotel Inglaterra and hope to return very soon to see more of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petlab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for six nights while visiting our daughter who is attending the University for the Spring. Great location near the school and near her apartment. Our room was on the fourth floor and facing the side street. It was rather loud at night but earplugs helped. The AC was not working, only warm air blew out. We kept our window open most of the night which did not help the noise. The room was small but the shower was large. The staff was very helpful and nice. We did not eat at the hotel but found a place down the street where we got coffee and danish for $1.50 EUR. Metro was accross the street and very easy to reach.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inglaterra: Perfect Access Point”
Reviews.Author: Purn
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is its location. The aerobus from the airport stops at the “Universitat” which is just 2 minutes walk from the hotel. You have to walk to the Plaça de Catalunya to catch the return bus, but this is just about 5 minutes away. A single bus ticket is from the airport is less than €5 and would recommend this as a convenient way of getting into Barcelona. Furthermore, the hotel is perfectly situated to access the tourist attractions North, South East and West of it. We walked to most of these districts and it is minutes from the hive of activity - Las Ramblas. Don’t be fooled however, although on the map Parc Guell and Montjuïc appear to be close proximity they are up a very steep incline. As one of our restaurant waitresses warned us -with her one English word- we would be “crazy” to walk there. However these sites were easily accessible on the Metro. As we were staying for six nights we booked a deluxe room with a private patio. The room itself turned out to be disappointingly small, and it would have been perfect to have some form of focal lighting so that we could sit outside after dark. We booked our room through the hotel website. Be warned that it does not include the 7% tax, nor does it include the €8/person that they charge for breakfast. The website also says that you can get free access to the pool and roof top terrace at its sister Hotel Majestic. Unfortunately it was undergoing renovation and would not be open until May 2008. The hotel receptionists were very helpful, fluent in English and gave good recommendations for restaurants etc. The hotel is clean, modern and provides you with an ample breakfast to start the day to see beautiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: mcon60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 6th to 9th February and found it to be an excellent base from which to explore the area.The accommodation was in a room with twin beds, TV, minibar, desk and a large spacious and spotless marble tiled en-suite. The beds and towels were changed daily. The room was not very large but adequate enough for a short stay. A longer stay would warrant asking for a larger room. Storage space was limited, a chest of drawers would have addressed the shortfall.The hotel is just two minutes from the Placa Catalunya which is at the top of the Rambla. There are great shops between the hotel and the Placa and El Corte Ingles store is in the square. We only ate in the hotel once as we found a great restaurant on the left of the Rambla, near the hotel, called Attic. This had great food and evener better prices. We ate breakfast in two places, Viena, a cafe next door to the hotel (freshly squeezed orange juice, croissants and coffee), this cost 9.50 euro for two of us. We also had the same in Cafe Zurich on the Placa and it was 12.50 euro there but we did not mind as the cafe is steeped in history, worth a visit. To see the city and outskirts the best way is the hop on, hop off bus which leaves Placa Catalunya very regularly. There are two routes, the North and South and these join up for ease of transfer. We were a bit anxious, having read previous reviews that the staff might not be welcoming but we did not have that experience, quite the reverse, in fact. I fell on the afternoon before leaving and broke my wrist and sprained my foot. The staff were great getting me ice and ice packs plus sympathy and advice re contacting medical assistance, if wished. I could not fault them and found them very warm and welcoming. TIP - if ordering a taxi do it from reception, the receptionist will have the taxi driver call into the lobby and she confirms his booking, this way you are secure in the knowledge that you have got a proper taxi. I would recommend this hotel to couples, older people, smaller families, business visitors and single persons. As it is a quiet select type hotel it might not appeal to younger groups. It is very quiet and peaceful there. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Top location and service but questionable deluxe rooms”
Reviews.Author: style_uncompromised
Reviews.Content: Dear reader, Here is my fresh experience of a 1-week stay at the Hotel Inglaterra in Barcelona, for you to consider if you wish. I chose this hotel for a holiday with my girlfriend, after having read promising reviews on this and other websites. We had a deluxe room with a terrace / patio and here is my experience of it. Strengths first. The hotel is very convenient to reach via bus (EUR 3.5) from the BCN airport to the Placa Universitat only 100 m away. The hotel service was impeccable, with very helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast buffet was affordable and of resonable quality at EUR 8 per person. Positives also include a clean hotel with nice decor and a superb location for easy access to the main tourist attractions. The room was reasonably clean (not under the bed !) and boasted a well-filled minibar and a modern SONY LCD TV. The patio was good to ventilate the smoke out of our clothes after restaurant visits. However. Deluxe rooms cost extra and I regret to write that our deluxe room with a terrace / patio was a minor disappointment. It was located on the ground floor, without any sunshine on the patio, and the room was nowhere near the 30 sqm as indicated on the hotel website. Around the double bed was only a 1m margin of free space. The bath was ca 3 sqm. The room also surprised us several times with a recurrent and quite unpleasant cloak-like odor. We even had problems with some loud and drunk neighbours who shouted for long in our corridor at 3.30 am. Had to call the reception to get those people quiet. Value for money ? Not for a deluxe room I would say. Take an ordinary room instead and save your money for something better. Or, alternatively, go all the way and book a suite. The hotel is a good one but somewhat misleading on the marketing side. Examples include the misleading room size, web pictures of the exterior looking way more grandiose and visible that reality (just a bit silly), and the promise that we could use the pool facility of their sister (luxury) hotel Majestic. It turned out to be closed for renovation. Again, silly, as it only takes a minute or two for them to adjust the hotel web to inform all customers about that. Some say the devil is in the detail. But there is space for improvement for the Inglaterra. This is only partly reflected in the hotel price. Beware of this and feel confident in booking another room type for a hopefully pleasant stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ugm1ejo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights in November 2006. I booked it based on reviews I'd read on trip advisor and I wasn't dissappointed. The Inglaterra Hotel is situated within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas, and just far enough away to be out of all the noise and hussle and bussle. It's entrance and lobby are nothing to write home about but are modern, bright and the reception staff helpful. We stayed in a standard double room. The room itself was spotlessly clean and modern. The bathroom was large and well equipped. The bathrooms have wonderful power showers - the only slight downside is that this tended to flood the bathroom floor. Breakfast was served in a basement room which again was modern, clean and well staffed. Selection of breaskfast was vast and I imagine most people would be able to find somehting they liked. Overall I found this hotel to be perfect in terms of both location and standard. Its not luxurious, nor traditionally spanish so if that is what you're looking for I suggest you go elsewhere. For what we wanted it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Flab
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I travel a lot and have seen many Hotels around Europe and the States but I must add that this Hotel was one of the better ones I have been to. The staff was very welcoming at my arrival and very helpful with giving me indications and recomendations for restauarant which were close to the Hotel, upon check-in they also gave me the access code for the Wireless as I had contracted the Business Package at their website which included Breakfast, Wireless access for the whole stay and a free Ironing for one shirt one day. The internet access was speedy and reliable as I needed it for work it was very important for me that is was reliable and fast. The breakfast was nice too and the lady was replenishing everything and cleaning the tables. The room was large enough for one person and was spotlessly clean everyday, I really recommend this Hotel if you are business traveler or coming for a sightseeing trip, a shame i hadn�t much time for sightseeing but I�m planning to visit Barcelona with my wife and kids as soon as i got my next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising...”
Reviews.Author: Johnnynose
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Barcelona, were we stayed at the hotel Inglaterra, part of the group of hotel Majestic. (Advertised as the sister hotel...blah! blah!) First they did not honor the package that I had booked online, telling me that I did something wrong when I booked! Second, they gave me a different room than the one requested, under pretext that we had a better view (first floor on the very, very noisy Pelai street!) Of course once I asked to change, I was told that the hotel was booked. The breakfast/bar/salon room was in a basement and totally uninviting...all this of course for the modest amount of 240 euros per night ($350!). The room was very small (even by european standard, while the bathroom was uselessly gigantic...but without heat, as we had to leave the bedroom door opened at night!). The location is fine as you are in walking distance for mostly everything, but really not worth the price. Across the street was the Hotel Jazz which semed much better. But don't hesitate to visit Barcelona...it's one of the best city in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Centrallly located”
Reviews.Author: IndieTravelGurl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Inglaterra delivered as promised. The staff was welcoming and spoke good English. The cleaning staff did a very good job every day. The rooms were spotless and very modern. The bathroom was large and had a very nice shower, and there were two generously sized bath towels that were twice the size of normal towels. In the deep bath tub, I took a bubble bath every day. My only complaint would be that the bed was rather uncomfortable. We asked for a double room and ended up with two single beds pushed together, not good for a romantic trip, not good for cuddling! The hotel has a great location. It is really close to Las Ramblas, Barri Gotic, Raval, without actually being IN any of those districts and their subsequent noise. It is also walking distance to the Passeig De Gracia. It is near the metro stop Universitat and Plaza Catalunya, so you could easily go to outlying areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Staff not so great.”
Reviews.Author: Poohbear40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and was in a wonderful location. The bathroom was very good sized and the shower was wonderful. The little restaurant was only mediocre....breakfast was only fair and the pizza we had one night was the worst ever...totally tasteless and pale... think it had been microwaved. The front desk staff were anything but welcoming and warm. This was too bad as the rooms were quite nice. I would think twice about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally happy”
Reviews.Author: travelwiseIllinois
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and so glad I did. Clean clean clean and with all the conveniences I would expect from a hotel in the states. Our room was ready on time, and the front desk staff very nice. Some nicer then others but overall very pleasant to deal with.They never messed up our wake up call, and had a cab ready at 4:15 a.m as requested. Lots of street noise but the noise proof windows took care of that! I would recommend it if you want to be off the La Rambla area, but right next to it. We did not take the breakfast, there are hundreds of places , one right next door at the D'Or, where you can eat for about $7.00 for a full breakfast. The buffet lines at hotel were long,...from what I could see. My only regret is location of hotel. Just a block from LaRambla area, it was conveniently located but next time I would stay in the Eixample area. Much more upscaled, just a nicer area to walk around in, whereas the Larambla area just did not appeal to me. Just my own preferance. Eixample's just a short walk to LaRambla area, if the LaRambla area is important to you. It was my least favorite place to be, but definately worth spending some time at but not necessarily stay near. Would be careful and do it right, read up on what to wear, how to act, ...just be smart and you will be fine. We registered with the state department, made copies (black and white only please) of our passports just in case we lost them, used a money belt, shielded pin numbers at ATM's...just be smart! Cabs are clean and CHEAP to use. Food everywhere is wonderful, not a bad experience once. Bathrooms clean everywhere we went, ...even the smoking in public areas and places not as awful as other European countries I have visited. We felt safe, three American women traveling together. Loved Barcelona.Overall, a very wonderful experience. Have fun, a really great city to visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: denverworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in this hotel. We found it in Karen Brown's book. The room was small and the bed was uncomfortable. The room also was very stark. It was quiet and the location is very good if you want to be in the middle of the action. My husband got food poisioning and the hotel was very good about getting a doctor to come to our room within 30 minutes. While the price/value for Barcelona was good, I would not stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but carpet in room need replacing”
Reviews.Author: B_HScotland
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona on a short break although there can be a bit of traffic noise at night. Room was fine and air conditioned. Breakfast was excellent at twelve euros but can be booked on arrival for eight euros. Staff are very helpful and courteous. With the Metro a stones throw away and an abundance of taxis, all the tourists attractions and shops are easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kel1982
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from the Inglaterra and cannot recommend it enough for exploring Barcelona. This was my first visit to Barcelona and I can definitely say that I will be returning. The city is great; great sights, great beach, great food, everything was great. Especially the weather which was around the 80 degree mark every day. I would definitely recommend that you do the bus tour to get a good idea of where everything is and the Magic Fountains are a must! The Inglaterra is perfectly positioned for exploring Barcelona (although I would add that we stayed for 4 nights and just about managed to see everything). Positioned just off the Ramblas this hotel is very smart. The room we had was very clean and modern with a balcony. I did try various websites but found that the hotel do extremely good deals direct and I found the staff very helpful and all spoke perfect English. We didn't manage to find time to visit the Majestic (the Inglaterra's sister hotel) but we did walk past it and it is situated in the busy shopping area and looked very nice. I would not hesitate to return to the Inglaterra or recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inglaterra, Carrer Pelai 14”
Reviews.Author: Tarwelaan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at (www.hotel-inglettera.com) here from Tuesday September 4 to Friday September 7, 2007. Unbeatable location at the top of Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. Very smart and well appointed hotel with superior fittings and a super bedroom. Nice terrace overlooking city. Outstandingly good breakfast and very nice people. Bought a package including breakfast and tickets for the city tour bus - essential in order to use time effectively. Very highly recommended. Middle priced but if your going to 'do' this wonderful city, then remember her by your stay as well as the sights. Apart from Antonio Gaudi, strongly recommend visiting the maritime and roman history museums- marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: Gianfi58
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in the hotel at the end of August with my son as gift for his degree. The room (#403) was cute and clean but very small. The wardrobe very little and without drawers to put things; I can hardly put only my small baggage inside to save space in the room. The windows in the room look at the internal courtyard. The safe-box was no present as we expected for the hotel category. The bathroom was quite spacious and clean. The first morning we woke up a bit late (9:30 am) and the buffet was not well refurnished: no croissants, no white bread; the days after we woke up earlier and all was ok. Remind: if you book the breakfast in advance (not included in my fare) you pay for it less, so I did. The front desk was kind and helpful and gave us some useful booklets and map of the city. The location is the strong point of this hotel, near the "Rambla", the Universitat Metro station and Placa Catalunya where you can also get the bus to the airport. Enjoy Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “snooty”
Reviews.Author: jooseloosie
Reviews.Content: Good location but realy just an average hotel for the cost. Very snooty lady working in the breakfast room. Shockingly breakfast waqs not included in the cost of the room..and was an additional 15 Euros each day! Very noisy hotel. It was modern and clean, but not fab. There are better places to stay i am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona- Hotel Inglaterra”
Reviews.Author: danesmith
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Barcelona was a Best Friends trip without any boyfriends, it was a short and intense stay, for that we choose the Inglaterra Hotel it was recommended by my parents who stayed there last year. We checked in very late (2 am)but that seemed no problem at all, the staff at the hotel was still very helpful at that time and we really enjoyed their kindness and willingness to help us with our doubts and problems. Our first 2 days we spent walking all day visiting everything we could and going out at night, so the third day our feet couldnt go any further so we decided to check out a bit the hotel and sunbath a bit on the roof terrace which as the receptionist said had been recently been refurbished with new plants and everything and it really looked nice although the view wasnt the best but still we felt if we were in a jungle. We decided to have dinner at the terrace with a downing sun, I ordered salmon, my friend a pizza and we shared a salad together with a nice bottle of cava, all in all the food was good, rooms were clean and trendy, staff was awesome and we couldn’t have enjoyed more our stay at the Hotel Inglaterra!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the inglaterra hotel”
Reviews.Author: cursey56
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel!!! The Hotel Inglaterra is perfect located, close to the main square and shopping area. 2 minutes walking to the famous ramblas & Mercat de la boqueria. Excellent room in the top floor with private terrace!!!! Great Breakfast in a very beautiful atmosphere. Staff were very very friendly and helpful. Overall the hotel was clean, modern & stylish. We used the swimming pool of the sister hotel called: hotel Majestic 5 stars 10 minutes walking, Fantastic!!!! We return the next summer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ispeaktheblondetruth
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a 3 star hotel in about as central a position as you could possibly want in Barcelona. Approx 5 minute walk from Las Ramblas. We upgraded rooms and got a lovely room at the back of the hotel with a small courtyard and some complimentary slippers in funky red colour for a change! Admitedly the view outside was uninspiring (a wall!) but on the the plus side we did have the small seating area outside and it was incredibly quiet at night. The hotel is on a very busy road so not sure what the road noise would be like on the front. The roof terrace was nice but we took advantage of the roof terrace of the sister hotel (The Majestic) the views there are spectactular and well worth seeing (unlike the pool which was just a little larger than my bath!). We didn't use the hotel restaurant facilities but chose to explore. Breakfast wise there is a Starbucks just across the road and we found a little restaurant called 'Ra' (near the back of the market) where we indulged in good old toast & marmalade!! The staff at the hotel all spoke English well and were very helpful. We did have a few problems buying the internet access but it was usually sorted out with little fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeeReg
Reviews.Content: Liked: good location, clean, quite, centric, near metro, nice staff. Disliked: expensive (200$) for a really small room, no brouchures in the loby. Tips: skip the expensive breakfast, eat in Viena next door or in Fresc-Co (all-you-can-eat salad/pizza/spagetti for 9 euro). Visit the Lizzaran tapas bar. You can see Dolphines in the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean modern room”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie07
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel conveniently located to allow us to walk most everywhere we went. It is also very close to metro line and the tourist bus departure location. Very clean and modern hotel. Our room was small and overlooked the street. The insulated windows kept any noise from the street out. The bathroom was almost as big as the room. Mini fridge in room, nice flat screen TV, and very comfortable bed with nice linens. We were on the Discovery Package so breakfast was included. The breakfast room was very nice but the meal was disappointing. Big selection (so if you like all you can chow buffets you’ll love it) but either the bread or pastries were not top quality or they weren’t fresh. I don’t know what the additional charge for the breakfast would have been but I would not have eaten breakfast here every morning if I had to pay extra. The top floor patio was a disappointment. There really isn’t a view of the city since you’re not up very high (6th floor) and no outside beverages or food are allowed so a romantic class of wine is out unless you order it from the hotel. We couldn’t even bring our Starbucks coffee up there. The front desk was helpful and spoke English. The only difficult thing about the hotel was the constant street person that was always present lying on the sidewalk down a door or two outside the hotel. Disabled beggars are the most distressing things about Barcelona. Their seemed to be quite a lot of them. Overall a great place to stay that gives you that “European” experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Thomas_UK
Reviews.Content: First time visit to Barcelona with girlfriend to explore this superb and vibrant city. Hotel is easily located and a few minutes walk from the top of Las Ramblas and ideally located to explore this city either on foot or via Metro stations located very near by. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and modern with LCD TV and welcoming Air Con. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Manager - Appalling Attitude Problem”
Reviews.Author: Bosco55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Inglaterra for 3 nights in early June 2007. On our first morning my girlfriend was using the shower, and no sooner had she got her hair full of shampoo, the water supply from the shower totally stopped. We tried for some time to figure out what was wrong but there seemed no good reason for the problem. Hair washing was finished in the small bathroom sink. We reported this to reception, who with some sympathy said they would look into it whilst we were out for the day. On our return we politely raised the issue with a new member of staff, introducing herself as the manager. Without hesitation she began to insist with some aggression, that WE were responsible and that we caused the water to stop by turning on and then off the supply in quick succession. We only turned the water flow lever on and off AFTER the water had totally stopped. The manager then involved the maintenance man, who with an aggressive tone, made similar remarks in spanish (which was translated for us) - We all went to the room - the maintenance man walked into our shower wearing his dirty work boots and became irate with us. Their explanation for the problem then changed - they now said the shower hose had kinked and this was the cause. However, we did not adjust the shower once and neither did we notice any "kinks" in the shower hose that caused the water to stop. A serious kink would have been glaringly obvious to us as we examined the shower to see why it was not working. The Manager - Never apologised, took no responsibility for the problem, made aggressive comments, lumped all blame on us, dismissed our every comment, and used the angry words of the maintenance man to back her up. We felt like we had been verbally trampled on and charged 160 Euros (excluding taxes) per night for the pleasure. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Room a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Younger64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Inglaterra June 9-12. The hotel is in a great location, near good restaurants, walking distance to Ramblas, Gothic Quarter and Metro. The hotel was fine and suited our needs. We had 'deluxe' room with a queen bed and french doors that opened onto a very small balcony. Some noise from the street, but not enough to keep us up at night if we closed the window and turned on the air conditioning. Hotel staff were freindly and helpful. Room was in OK repair. Three comments: 1. Room was very small, and often two people would be in each other's way during busy times (like when getting ready in the morning). In all fairness, the hotel did offer to upgrade us from the Deluxe room to a suite when we arrived for 35 euros a night, and we declined (since we already thought at 210 euros a night was enought to pay for a hotel). 2. As others have written, no full length mirror in the room. 3. Bed was not comfortable, both my wife and myself had sore backs after sleeping on the bed, and we typically are not picky when it comes to beds in hotels. We did eat breakfast the first morning at the hotel for 12 Euros each. Breakfast was OK, but we decided to explore the area a bit, so we ate all subsequent meals outside of the hotel. There are hundreds of restaurants within walking distance. We found that in general you get what you pay for (expensive restaurant, better food, cheap restaurant, cheap food). Best restaurant experience was the L' Acadamie and Plaza St. Just in the Gothic Quarter. Hard to find (better have a good map!), not cheap but not too exhorbidant (80 Euros for the two of us), and excellent food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: lulu1980
Reviews.Content: I booked the Inglattera as a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday and we loved it. I honestly could not fault it - the excellent location, service, style and comfort ensured we had a wonderful stay. One word of warning - the taxi that the hotel booked for us to take us to the airport completely ripped us off - which was not the best end to a wonderful weekend! None the less, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris RJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 21-25th May with 2 friends. Location of hotel great and on arrival we were pleased to receive upgrades which included a small balcony within our room. Unfortunately although my wife and I had a very spacious and large bathroom, there was a distinct 'drain' smell coming from it. We complained and athough it improved slightly, it was still evident on last day. Staff very polite and helpful (useful as I had my wallet stolen and was given helpful advice by hotel staff). Breakfasts were good and we ate there in the evening on one occasion which was OK and reasonably priced. Easy stroll to Ramblas, port area as well as many of Gaudi's notable creations. Overall very pleasant and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: hubbotrelo
Reviews.Content: I booked the Inglaterra Hotel as a surprise for my Patner Keith's Birthday and it more than came up to my expectations. The location is fabulous and although on a main road we were completely unaware of the traffic noise during our stay. I booked a classic room which was more than adequate, very well appointed with lots of hanging space and priced very competitively. The Bathroom was spotlessly clean with good quality products to use and a very powerful shower. The staff were all extremely helpful, the morning receptionist (sorry I did not catch her name), recommended a fabulous tapas restaurant nearby called Ciudad Condal - an absolute must to visit - the food was so good that we returned again the following day! The roof top garden is a wonderful bonus, on our arrival we sat in the warm sunshine and drank ice cold cava! what could be better after leaving a cold wet England behind! Thankyou to all the staff at the Inglaterra for a thoroughly enjoyable stay - we will be returning (soon I hope...??!!).

Reviews.Title: “a word of warning for non smokers”
Reviews.Author: 74white
Reviews.Content: Last summer, we arrived at Inglaterra, having booked a non smoking room 6 months in advance. They showed us to a room that looked pleasant and had a balcony but stank of smoke so badly that we couldn't stay in it for more than a few minutes, let alone sleep there. The hotel had no other rooms available. They offered to upgrade us to their sister hotel The Majestic, ''8 minutes walk away'', Now you might think we'd struck lucky, BUT it's closer to 20 minutes walk away and the room you get as an upgraded customer, though well furnished, is very dark as it has only a tiny window that looks onto a ventilation shaft. It was supposed to be guaranteed non-smoking but on opening this tiny window I found at least 10 stubbed out cigarettes on the ledge. When I spoke to the manager, Gemma, of the Inglaterra she said that if I booked again, I should email her personally and explain, and she would ensure the same thing didn't happen again. Well, in February this year I booked and sent an email to Gemma AND the reservations desk AND various other email addresses listed on the hotel's website, over a period of weeks and guess what? No reply. I persisted but came to the conclusion that maybe thay don't really have to try any more, so I decided to cancel. At 250 euros per night I expect rather better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good, convenient choice”
Reviews.Author: bhutan02
Reviews.Content: Inglaterra is just off Las Ramblas in the thick of things. Recently renovated older building. Small room with modern furniture and a tiny balcony overlooking side street; nice, modern bath. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Skip the over-priced breakfast buffet.--Starbucks is just across the street. Small but very enjoyable roof garden for reading or sunning (room service available). A minor complaint: superior (upgraded) room was still pretty small. Over 5 night-stay, most other guests were UK tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing and shopping ...”
Reviews.Author: hockeysticks
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location, right beside the Universitat metro stop and within easy walking of the Ramblas, Rambla de Catalunya, Playa de Catalunya and any number of great shops. The staff were very friendly and helpful upon arrival and gave us maps on which they marked out some lovely places to eat. Our only problem was that I had specifically booked a double bed in our room but we got two singles. I enquired about this and was told that double beds were limited and not guarenteed, in fairness to the recpetion staff by the time we came back from lunch they had re-made the bed as a double (as in double sheets and covers) which was ok. This is a lovely hotel, very clean and in nice sunny weather (which we didn't have sadly) there is a lovely Solarium on the top floor with sun loungers and tables and chairs. Location is definitely its strongest point!

Reviews.Title: “Average and expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: akabusi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and although the location is really good, we were a bit disappointed with the hotel. As it was a special occasion, we had upgraded to a superior room. I have to say, I expected something more than we got. I even checked at reception that we had been upgraded. Our room was definately standard and was very basic. The bathroom had an old shower over the bath and a fabric shower curtain. The room itself was very small. The balcony we had been promised was a ledge you could just about stand on. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room and so each time we wanted a drink, we had to go to the basement restaurant and pay 2euros. The hotel and room were very clean but not special. The hotle staff were pleasant but gave us 2 awful recommendations for local restaurants. In one, I had paella with a crust on the top where it had been overheated in the microwave! The good points to this hotel were definately the cleanliness and its location. It is a 2 minute walk from Playa Catalunya and La Rambla so perfect for evening and access to transport. Definately don't waste your money on a taxi form the airport - the bus drops you off 2 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel / Service was just so-so”
Reviews.Author: TravlerNotATourist
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Inglaterra. I reserved a Superior room and was hoping for an outside terrace (like the photos on their web site), but did not get this. I was disappointed, but we did have a room with a king-size bed (which is request only), so I did not request a room move. Hotel very trendy, comfortable, great shower and excellent location. One complaint: The staff refused to have any ice delivered to my room when they saw me walk in with 2 sodas that were purchased at a nearby market. They told me that "you're not allowed to have beverages in the hotel that you didn't buy here". Surprised they would aggravate someone spending several nights at their hotel like that over ICE!

Reviews.Title: “not quite what we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: ex-thompson-rep
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Barcelona we loved it so much last year we went again this year. First and last time at this hotel though! Arrived on the 4 march for my birthday trip so had booked what i thought was a superior room which looked amazing with table and chairs outside etc. On arrival was shown into what was shown on website as a classic room so felt cheated and that i had paid over the odds, when requested at reception for correct room was told in very brisk manner that they only had 2 of the rooms i requested and basically tough.
