Room was very noisy as hotel is situated on main road busy all night and frequently smelt of drains. I would not stay here again or recommend to anyone thinking about it there are SO many other hotels in Barcelona which would make your trip more enjoyable, so keep looking! Such a FAB city you want all the elements including the hotel to provide what you pay for. have fun x

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: UkATourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. It seems to be recently refurbished and is extremely clean, britght with modern furnishings. I cannot fault it at all.. The staff were polite and friendly. There was a big buffet breakfast available which I recommend. I strongly recommend this hotel and I give it A*

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mellymarz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 7th-9th January. Rooms provided everything we needed, very clean and smart. Great views from balcony. Great bathroom with fantastic power shower. Staff were extremely helpful with all the questions we asked and there were plenty!. In great location, 30mins and a 22 euro taxi from airport. Metro and bus route just around corner, most sights within walking distance. You will be walking alot, but there are lots alternatives. Recommend buying tegeta ticket-6.4 euros-gives 10 trips on either metro or bus, can use for as many people as you like , just put card thru bus/metro machine for as many people are travelling. Also Touristica bus good,@ 20 euros, 3 routes-red,yellow and green, u can get listing of route on barcelona web page or plenty info given at hotel. Went for 40th birthday and 30th, extremely recommend eating at La Crema Canela, good choice for vegetarians and meat eaters alike which our group of people had both-address Madoz, 6-just off La Ramblas. Fantastic seasonal choice Starters @4euros/Main @ 8-10euros. Also great vegetarian restaurant is Sesamo and Organic Orgasmic. If you go into the market just off La ramblas 'La Boquera' there is a stand there for Organic Orgasmic-great stand up food, and they will tell you how to get to restaurant-all veggie and organic, we had huge meal for 8euros each! Definitely go see Casa Batlo, and make sure you get lift up to top, and visit La Sagradia Familia and do the same-all Gaudi's work, jaw droppingly amazing. Weather was great while we were there, like a sunny day here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paparajote
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a holiday break and as we had booked it in advance got a deal of 4 nights for the price of three from the hotel webpage. We booked two rooms and both were very large compared to standard sizes in Europe, very clean and modernly furbished. The fact that it is just steps away from the "Rambla" makes it a perfect location for tourists. As the title says, we loooved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lezter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Inglaterra for three nights in December. The location was great. Very central to many shops and restaurants and only a few minutes walk away from the main bus stops. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, they spoke and understood english very well. Our room was small but had everything we needed including a small balcony. It was very quiet during the evenings/night so we could get a good nights sleep. The only bad point to make was the breakfast (this was served between 7 and 11 am) some of the food had gone dry and hard(bread/cheese/ham) when left out and not covered up,and the fresh fruits(melon,fruit cocktail) going slightly brown again not covered up. Although the hot breakfast are well covered and very warm. Overall opinion we would definitely return and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great fluffy towels !”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiretrotter1
Reviews.Content: Yes the towels were very fluffy and the hotel was in a very nice situation. The breakfasts were good as it was self service and you could have most things. We had a superior room on the second floor, this was fine but there was rather a nasty smell in there and we thought it must have been the grubby stained carpet. Very sorry to have to say this as everything else was fine. I just felt I didnt really want to walk in the room without shoes on... I lived in Barcelona 25 years ago and went to the University there, the hotel was just a short walk away as it was from the centre of town... I hope all the rooms didnt have the problem ours did but I wouldn't stay there again... as the stale smell in the room made me feel a bit sick...

Reviews.Title: “Hated the City, Loved the Room”
Reviews.Author: Lias723
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona on October 22 after spending 1 week in Paris. I had booked the room online on the hotel's website and had been in communication with the Staff via email regarding price and discounts. As soon as we arrived, we were abruptly notified that the price we had confirmed online was incorrect and it was going to be an additional 20 euros/night for the room. Not a good first impression and it was all downhill from there. The only positive thing was that the roms were beautiful. We were in 211 which is a corner room with high ceilings, modern decoration, and 2 balconies. Had I stayed the room the entire time, I probably would have had a more positive experience. They offered a Breakfast Buffet in their restaurant for a whopping 12 Euros and charged 20 Euros/week for internet service. The location was ideal, only 1 block from La Rambla and there are open-air bus tours that leave from there all day to take you around the city. It was ALWAYS crowded everywhere you walked and we found the street performers bizarre and freakish rather than amusing and entertaining. Other than walk up and down La Rambla and seeing some of the few (and uninteresting) sights like La Sagrada Familia (Waste of time as you are charged 8 Euros to walk through the eyesore and it is under COMPLETE construction as it has been for over 100 years), the Olympic Stadium from 1992 (Yawn) and the Cathedral (You guessed it, under construction too!) there really is nothing more to do. I also noticed a disturbing number of beggars everywhere holding everything from babies to dogs that all appeared sedated or dead. Even saw a completely naked old man (twice!) walking the streets without any hesitation. WEIRD! After 3 days, we had had enough of the circus and actually cut our trip short by 4 days to come home early. A week in Barcelona would have been the equivilant to Chinese water torture and we were thrilled to get out early regardless of fees incurred by the airline. I would NEVER return there nor would I recommend Spain to anyone. I would have rather spent another week in glorious Paris. C'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Place”
Reviews.Author: Bibbbabe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hotel Inglaterra, its in a great location, ideal for everything. Room was spotless with towels to die for!! Very central to tourist bus, which is a must. Got the bus from airport, which was ideal 7.50 euros for two people, drop off at Universitat (top of road). Have tapas in the back streets of Las Ramblas. Travel on the cable car at your own peril!! Get off at San Sebastian and walk along the beaches to one of the cheap little restaurants. Barcelonetta is great with lots of bars and cafes. You football lovers visit Camp Nou (wow). A fantastic place, great hotel, what more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “best accomodation in barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: r_torradeflot
Reviews.Content: I only have compliments for the entire staff of the 'Hotel Inglaterra'. They were so so kind and helpful with us. The hotel is situated in the best area! Public transports in 2 minutes walking! (Plaza Catalonia Square: bus, metro, train)There's also a car parking very close! The hotel is very stylish, very confortable beds, plasma Tv, modern bathrooms, and the rooftop is an peaceful oasis inside the city! There's a very good relation 'price-quality'. Thanks so much for your wanderful hospitality! I really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gergema
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. Very clean, great location, very quiet. Easy (less than 5 minute) walk from the Placa Universidad where the bus from the airport dropped us. Metro close by and only 5 minute walk from Las Rambla. I felt very safe in the area (2 women traveling). Tons of shopping on the block and not far from the more expensive Paseo de Gracia shops. Little cafe next door for breakfast (cafe and croissant for two was less than 5 euros). Good suggestions for tapas from the staff and a pretty roof deck which I could enjoy even in January. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “workmen on scaffolding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we paid more money than we would normally pay as the hotel looked good, however there was no mention of the hotel being worked on .we were woken up very early by the noisey workmen ,and when i went to open the curtains i was faced with a spanish decorator on scaffolding looking in to my room, so i had to keep the curtains permanently closed making the room dark and miserable.we mentioned this to reception but there were no more rooms to be moved into, hence we checked out early and stayed in a better hotel on the main las ramblas which was much beter.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Hotel Inglaterra. The rooms were clean, the service was outstanding and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Inglaterra Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer De Pelai, 14, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
